author: {'steamid': '76561198036297204', 'num_games_owned': 1295, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1796, 'last_played': 1661542369}
review:
Fat, lazy [i]Wum[/i] is kicked out from his room in a Wumhouse because of his unhealthy love for an ice cream -he keeps ordering it to his room, but as the transport tubes got clogged up because of it, he needs to pick it up himself down in the lobby. As [i]Wums[/i] hold items on their heads he leaves a huge mess behind him! That's enough for the Wumhouse manager and our little hero is thrown out from his balcony! Out in the wilderness begins his search for a new home. And maybe he will even solve a few mysteries from the past and even save the world before an unexpected destruction.

[i]Wuppo[/i] is a charming game full of funny characters and silly moments. Both hand-drawn graphics and catchy soundtrack suit the game well. Wearing items on your head is a great feature and I have enjoyed changing my appearance through the game. The items are also nicely varied (purely cosmetic, weapons, food, for stealth…) and it was fun to try them out. Lore of the world is interesting and you can uncover it even more by collecting filmstrips which record the most important historic events, basic information about the world or some mysterious writings from the long forgotten past.

Gameplay wise it's a metroidvania. There are no basic enemies, except for some pests in one location, but the game is filled with a lot of bosses! Some of them are mandatory for a story progression, others are optional. Few of them are rather hard even on lower difficulty, but luckily there is no penalisation for dying, you just start the fight again. Playing on hardest was quite a challenge, but still fun.

Whole game can be experienced in co-op as the second player can assume the role of our sidekick, a talkative bird Denksnavel. Sadly his possibilities are quite limited - he can fly around and attack (some of the enemies can't be hurt by him, but he can at least protect our [i]Wum[/i] by blocking some of the projectiles - that was pretty handy actually). And that’s all for the second player. Also he is bound to us as there is no split screen and he can't leave the screen on his own. This part is lacking, it would be a lot more fun if there could be two [i]Wums[/i] together. Quite disappointing is the fact that your friend can't help you in Boss rush… yeah, I suck in it on my own. XP

All in all we have rather enjoyed the [i]Wuppo[/i] and can recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561199230991327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1676641820}
review:
打折四块八，只能说物超所值了。
标签上标着银河城，但感觉也不太像，就不在这里讨论了。
这个游戏带给我最特殊的体验，大概就是那些数量繁多，但是又不能交谈的npc了。有时就这么漫步在大街上，周围走过很多的乌姆，真有一种自己也生活在这里的感觉。坐列车什么的都要老老实实地等车，虽然有时候真的花时间，但也意外的多上了几分真实感，坐电车的话也还好，大不了就走过去，也不麻烦。
反正是一款很可爱的游戏，要是主题乐园能做得更大一点就好了（哇塞，里面真的很好玩）。
另外因为传送要后期才能开的关系，前期最好按流程走，收集幻灯片啥的以后再做更好哦

author: {'steamid': '76561198206123620', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1670186508}
review: 7小时通关，独特世界架构+可爱治愈的艺术风格共同构成了一个wuppo的世界，流程偏向无引导的线性流程，可供交流的npc很多，制作组很会藏一个个有趣的角色。休闲的时候来玩不错，多人联机带上你朋友（如果有的话）很开心大概。游戏后期有些疲软，boss战设计有时候摸不着头脑。4元入手不亏，本地汉化可用做的不烂。

author: {'steamid': '76561198314944844', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1706512736}
review:
听说是个内容很丰富的好游戏，但是真的好容易卡关我好笨玩不下去……真的好想通关
——
23/5/27
总算给我通关了……时间拖太久已经忘掉前面什么剧情了，有空全收集
很可爱很有意思，美中不足是缺乏引导，玩起来记得多看看攻略！
顺带一提中文翻译，很多地方过于生硬，实在是不太符合中文表达习惯，甚至看着中文我都能直接想象到翻译前的英文原句了（），还有部分英文没有翻译完全，一阶段班克伦特消失之后的对话似乎是打错字了。总之看着不太舒服，明明中文翻译贡献者名单超级长诶……其他语种都是一两个人，为什么会是这个样子……

author: {'steamid': '76561199180247393', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1669718870}
review:
超级可爱的一款游戏！里面的葵花狮子头感觉不太聪明的亚子，可恶的大厨竟然对我图谋不轨，虽然我明白自己身为高贵的巫姆并且充满人格魅力，被别人垂涎也不能怪别人。
文本量较多，几句语言描写便刻画出了形形色色的人物。手绘画风有着别样的美感。游戏处处充满细节（喜欢这款游戏的重要原因），内容特别特别丰富，不同难度有着各种细微差异，足以见作者的用心良苦！最后的大脸充满恶趣味，略显魔性，足以见作者是个有趣的灵魂！
4块的wuppo你冲不冲？冲！冲！冲！冲冲！喜欢横版冒险的无脑闭眼入。

author: {'steamid': '76561199138417220', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1703319618}
review:
这是一款非常有趣的游戏，整个游戏流程下来可以看到整个wuppo世界各个个体各式各样的生活，每个个体（包括主人公自己）都有自己追逐的目标。
游戏的画风十分可爱，并且各个地区都具有各个鲜明的种族风格（wuppo中的种族）。
尽管游戏结束后，你仍可以在游戏中获得快乐，作者为游戏中的很多角色添加了小彩蛋，使这款游戏变得更加生动。
整款游戏的战斗比较简单，但你克以在开始游戏前选择游戏难度来挑战。
缺点的话，应该就是翻译问题了，在一些对话中比较拉跨，但是不影响游戏的剧情。
整体下来，这款游戏的性价比很高

author: {'steamid': '76561198418590333', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10202, 'last_played': 1711039945}
review:
I have a whole lot to say about this game.
First of all - It's amazing.
It's rare that I find a game that I can enjoy any time of the year, and it's one of them. Definitely №1 my favorite game
If you've loved the game - I highly recommend joining the Discord, of which existence I didn't know about the summer of this year.
I have no idea how this game manages to charm me but the soundtrack, visual design, plot, lore, and the characters all combine in a weird scheme that just leaves me astounded by how amazing this game is.
And also, very charmful and kind developers. Love 'em.
I'm really hyped for the future games

author: {'steamid': '76561198080196486', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1667305348}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Wuppo: The Definitive Edition is a game developed by Knuist & Perzik and published by SOEDESCO. It was released on Sep 29th 2016, with first development footage (as found on the “Perzik & Knuist” channel) available all the way back in March 2013. The game follows a nameless protagonist, who’s a “wum”, one of the many creatures inhabiting the colorful world of Wuppo. Thrown out of his house, he’s thrust into the wild, to brave a perilous world of adventure and secrets galore.
For brevity’s sake, here is a list of PROs and CONs, before the more long-form review:

[h2]CONS[/h2]
- A little obtuse sometimes (x)
- Grindy coin farming
- Some bosses are a little more hit or miss
- Wait times (i.e. for the [spoiler]Popo Train[/spoiler], the [spoiler]Wondersplenk[/spoiler] rides and public transport in [spoiler]Popo City[/spoiler])
- Length of passages (e.g. the bridge in [spoiler]Popo City[/spoiler])
- Way too long sequences (e.g. performing a job that requires you to throw 150 newspapers onto different wums, [spoiler]Fnakball[/spoiler])
→ Exploring can (at times) be a bit boring and tedious
→ Kinda feels like the game is wasting your time/testing your patience at times
- Weird sound mixing (particularly the sounds of one boss – [spoiler]Breevis[/spoiler], and hit sounds); brief, very loud distortion, when using fast travel
- easy to skip too much dialogue, by trying to fast forward it, via LMB (using spacebar can mitigate this a bit)
- game often starts minimized, and locks cursor in the top left corner of the screen, you have to fiddle around with Alt + Tab to get into the actual game
- Lots of actions are slow or tedious (such as having to go through the menu every time to sell stuff)
- Fast travel unlocks only shortly before the game’s ending, and some locations still require quite a long trek to get to

[h3]Minor:[/h3]
- Some dialogue was off-screen a few times, i.e. the cutscene after the final boss fight, getting [spoiler]tourist info in Popo City[/spoiler]
- You have to figure out where every fast travel point takes you on your own
- Water is poisonous at fishing docks, even after clearing Kneft infestation (the rest of the water no longer hurts you)

[h2]Neutral:[/h2]
~ The base difficulty of the game is pretty easy

[h2]PROS[/h2]
+ Fantastic, unique visual style
+ Awesome OST by Thomas de Waard
+ A world that feels incredibly alive (lots of other characters, just walking around, quite a bit more populated than the usual game world)
+ Enormous amount of attention to detail
+ A particularly pleasant story, with imaginative twists and turns, which also happens to touch on some interesting topics, like self-actualization, predestination, division, friendship, the value we place on work (plus some other subtle political and philosophical topics)
+ An unexpected amount of lore, and really great lore at that
+ Really witty and well-written dialogue
+ Fun secrets (though, refer to “x”)
+ Some very interesting bosses and encounters (+ One super unique boss!)
+ Combat is pretty fun, if very simple, for the most part
+ Really great, miscellaneous mechanics, and sections utilizing different, sometimes one-off puzzle ideas
+ Constant updates, very active and passionate dev team, adding new content every once in a while (though this may have ceased with the release of “Definitive Edition”, I am unsure)


[h1]Review[/h1]
Wuppo is what you get, when someone has an idea in middle school about wanting to make an incredible game, from their childhood notebook full of doodles. It’s a beautiful, tried and true method — tried, for one, by Eiichiro Oda, creator of the Manga “One Piece”. In this way, Wuppo is also an exercise in love and authenticity. The art of the game is inspired, it lives and breathes and marches to the rhythm of its own heart. The score by Thomas de Waard is a diverse selection of pieces, all setting the stage for the equally idiosyncratic visuals, characters, environments and gameplay. It’s a game full of laughs and comedy, and quickly, humorously, wittly resolved conflict, and yet, it still has interesting things to say, mayhap even teach. Brought to a point, Wuppo is an almost iconoclastic sweep into the often serious, dark and brooding artistic environment. It is jovial in a way, which can scarcely be likened to anything other than a Disney movie or Nintendo property.
It is a game I had my problems with, a myriad of them, as evident in the bullet points. Some of these problems are simple differences in philosophy (I’ll elaborate in a moment) and others genuine problems I have with the flow of the game (and some smaller bugs, here and there). Chief among these issues, is a general sense of your time being wasted. There is an elevator to get into one of the main areas of the game, but, like all public transport throughout Wuppo, it works on an actual timer, making you wait multiple minutes, as you would in real life, to catch the elevator, and then making you sit in it, for quite a while longer, till you finally reach your desired destination. In the following area, called [spoiler]Popo City[/spoiler] you will find trams, these too, work on a timer, making you wait each time to cross a giant bridge in the center, or making you walk the bridge’s length; a length that rivals the comedy of the infamous ladder of Metal Gear Solid 3 (at least I think it’s 3, never played the games), but it only does so the first or second time you have to cross it. The shell shock of repeated tedium hits you soon enough.
These wait times have actually been explained by the developers in the Steam discussion forums [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/400630/discussions/0/350544272220383836/#c350544272221403914]here[/url]. To paraphrase briefly: [spoiler]Popo City[/spoiler] is meant as a cinematic setpiece, and riding to it for only a few seconds would be inconsistent with its image as a faraway place, thus causing ludo-narrative dissonance. The wait times for certain [spoiler]theme park attractions[/spoiler] are based off the developer’s experiences of excitement, while waiting in line for a [spoiler]ride[/spoiler] in real life. The case they make is a fascinating one. Putting emphasis on wait times as a form of artistic expression is quite striking in video games, not unlike the deliberate use and exploration of silence in music (John Cage) or the study of negative spaces in art.
Though I enjoyed what the developers attempted to do here, I still found myself, on the basic level of enjoying or not enjoying something, to be rather annoyed by this at times, and felt like my time was being wasted a little, and my patience tried. Similar feelings were evoked by some of the game’s activities (e.g. jobs) and coin farming — which I felt could’ve been streamlined much more — as well as other miscellaneous actions.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
Nevertheless, going beyond the basic, knee-jerk responses I had, Wuppo was an incredible game, with amazing dialogue, a beautiful, eccentric world, with equally interesting characters and expansive lore, with an overall flair all around it; combat, which — while simplistic — somehow fits the “middle school" feeling I spoke of at the beginning of this review perfectly.
Wuppo is an effort of many years of hard work and love. As an artist, I may only tip the hat to  Knuist & Perzik, as well as everyone else who helped create this splendid piece of art. The game pushes the boundaries and experiments, and while I couldn’t find it within myself to 100% it, for reasons of personal tedium and time constraints, I can recommend it beyond the shadow of a doubt. I feel it is always important to see what makes a piece of art special, and what the artists were trying to say, make you feel, create — going beyond the simple “like”/”dislike” paradigm. So despite my slightly mixed experience:

[h3]Much Love To Knuist & Perzik — as well as SOEDESCO — For Sharing Their Beautiful Art With The World![/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198057405014', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1666273649}
review:
Wuppo is a 2D metroidvania with a charming visual style but unfortunately that is the only good thing about it. Game has minimum combat and character development as you could expect from a metroidvania. Instead it is focused on story, dialogs and quests. That is not a bad thing by itself but... story makes no sense at all, some random events happen one after another and none of them is actually interesting. Character are boring and dialogs never go farther than jokes and gags.

Game has almost no common enemies and combat but it has plenty of bosses. Solid boss fights could compensate for a mediocre gameplay but most bosses are plain bad. Early game bosses are pathetically easy and basic while late game ones are hard for all the bad reasons including bad camera angles, poorly telegraphed attacks, lots of RNG etc.

Wuppo is not terrible but it is just boring to play. Nothing really happens, you do boring stuff for no reason and with no reward and keep doing it until it is (finally) finished. Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 758, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1665034549}
review:
A seriously unique journey that always has something weird up its metaphorical sleeves. Wuppo takes a while to really get going, but once it does, it's impossible not to love the strange world, unpredictable plot, deep lore, secrets, and silly characters that it throws at you.

I feel like the term ‘metroidvania’ very loosely applies to this independently operating 2D platformer. Action mostly takes a back seat to hopping around to find necessary items and converse with people. Combat remains fairly consistent with upgrades being rare and movement remaining the same throughout. So, don’t go in with the wrong expectations. Also, the unusual structure of the game means it can be a bit easy to get confused every now and then. So stay patient, check all your options, and pay close attention to the dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010974276', 'num_games_owned': 2195, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1663458455}
review:
Честно? Игра очень милая, правда. У неё есть неплохо прописанный мир и лор, есть забавные персонажи, есть глупые ситуации, над которыми наблюдаешь с улыбкой.
Но вот я не совсем понимаю, что она из себя представляет.

Если это метроидвания, то со своей задачей она справляется плохо, если сравнивать с тем же "Ори". С навигацией очень туго - как таковой понятной карты нет - есть лишь очертания открытых комнат с "вёдрами" сохранения (по крайней мере, встроенной адекватной карты нет, я не исключаю, что она появится после как предмет). Если ты случайно упал, то изволь подниматься хрен знает сколько обратно, а локации могут быть очень большими/высокими. Никаких телепортов просто не существует пока что. Некоторые дороги просто ведут в тупики - а забраться туда не то что просто.

Если это шутэмап с элементами платформера, то некоторые боссы ну прям дико хардкорные - сносят много, получают мало. Да, рано или поздно их проходишь - но начинает бесить, когда ты раза два или три "сливаешься" на последних хп босса. Да и стрелять неудобно - пока что два открытых оружия стреляют по короткой параболе - и нужно подходить близко к боссу, постоянно рискуя. Слишком хардово выходит для такой милой игры.

И я пока не понимаю, где можно гарантированно получать деньги. За победы над боссами и доставку плёнок старику дают немного, но покупаемых предметов куда больше/они куда дороже. Возможно, это будет реализовано позже, но дойти бы до этого момента.

И визуальный стиль, если честно, вызывает вопросы. Не всегда понятно, где задник, а где часть двухмерного пространства, по которому можно передвигаться - иногда они просто имеют одинаковую цветовую гамму. Персонажи милые, а вот локации какие-то странные.

Так что чисто моё субъективное мнение, не зашло. Может, когда-то продолжу, но, если честно, пока что не хочется.

review:
一场由冰淇淋引发的惨案。

虽然引导约等于没有，中文翻译也很不行，但捏麻麻的画风太可爱了，一下子治好了我的电子阳痿。4元钱入的，内容值60。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969730757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1659747589}
review:
Hard not to get a cozy-fuzzy feeling in the heart about this one.
One of those true works of love, where the "how" is almost more powerful than the "what".
That the game doesn't necessarily make you go WHOA is a strength here. It is more like a sunbathing session or just aimlessly wandering around in the forest and enjoying every moment of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199157134403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1682550295}
review: Jogo muito bom, ele possui bastante história e enredo, porém muitas vezes ele fica tedioso ou até mesmo você não sabe onde está seus objetivos, o mapa é bastante "precário", apenas mostra onde estão os baldes de salvamento, o que dificulta bastante se você estiver perdido. Apesar disso recomendo bastante o jogo, é possível explorar bastante e fazer/comprar coisas que você quer, o jogo te dar total liberdade de opinião e escolhas.

review:
할인할 때 샀지만 정가로 주고 사도 아깝지 않을 양질의 컨텐츠..
스토리도 괜찮고 캐릭터가 너무 귀여움
대신 후반부 퍼즐 하나가 골때리고, 맵이 조금 복잡하다고 느낄 수 있음
본인이 모든 수집품, 도전과제를 다 깨야 직성이 풀리는 성격이라면 게임을 하다가 스트레스를 받게 될 가능성이 높음

author: {'steamid': '76561198152949139', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1660400254}
review:
촉!촉!하게 만들어주지!!!

촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉촉! (퍼엉!!!) 또로로로로로롱~!

게임이 정말 귀엽고 아기자기하면서 근사하고 재밌다.
그리고 중간에 퍼즐깨다가 머리 터질뻔했다.
느긋하게 살 집을 찾으려다 광대한 모험에 휘말리는
우리친구 스칼리왁과 뱅크스네이블의 이야기.
딱보면 알겠지만 귀엽고 동글동글한 웜들의 세상을 탐험하는 게임이다.
플레이타임도 적당하고, 외설적이거나 자극적인 요소가 하나도 없으며 등장인물들의 대화또한
자연스럽고 정겹다. 욕설은 당연히 없고 다루는 무기도 사실 촉촉총이라는 페인트건이다. 
플레이어가 어디로 쫄래쫄래 이동하던 스토리에 방해되거나 딜레이되는거 하나도 없고, 오히려
메인퀘 도중에 잠깐 들러보는 서브퀘 느낌으로 알잘딱하게 잘 짜여져있다. 여행하다가 지치면
가만히 쭈구려서 잠도 자고 커피숍 들려서 모닝한잔 홀짝 마시다가 기분 살짝 째져서 물감테러
한번 해줄수도 있고, 암시장 들러서 물감총 개조도 할 수 있다.




 하느님 부처님 보살님 예수님 기타 신님 제발... 멀티 나올때 짱깨와 핵쟁이가 없게 해주세요....

author: {'steamid': '76561198995387103', 'num_games_owned': 6510, 'num_reviews': 3379, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1658660622}
review:
乌姆，乌姆，我要回家...^.*

翻译有机翻痕迹，但是不太影响。游戏不错，看得出来诚意，画风音乐很有特色，推荐。得到乌鸦后还可以双人本地合作。

不足，bug或建议等：we need menu move have sound. 菜单界面移动光标应当有音效。we need dpad move. 手柄应当有震动。

本平台，本平台掉卡零钱，fanatical，杉果，支付宝红包，它处自定义包入的本体加全dlc约4元。目前就这，看以后追评。

review:
다들 짱귀여운 워포 하세요

author: {'steamid': '76561197972584572', 'num_games_owned': 1637, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1545803502}
review:
#Beaten on Switch - Around 10 Hours I think

Wuppo is a very well made paper mario-inspired adventure game. It has puzzles, platforming, item collecting (for objectives, not a collect-a-thon). and bosses.  A funny game with a fun story and characters that isnt (usually) too challenging but makes you work a little.

Pros:
- Funny
- Fun bosses and exploration
- A unique world to explore

Cons:
- There were a few times i didnt know where to go.  Only a few
- There was one puzzle section that took me a while longer than it should have to figure out

review:
优点：
1、世界观有趣，元素众多，
2、地图比较丰富，
3、boss战还不错，燃起来了，

建议：
1、其实还可以有很多内容可以在现有的基础上深挖下去，
2、道具的组合方式也可以搞点新花样，
3、我拿xbox手柄玩，周期性会卡，帧率很慢的样子，不知道是不是我电脑问题

最后：没玩过瘾，期待第二部（不知道有没有第二部）

review: 很好玩儿！有点小脾气的小巫姆太太太太可爱了了，剧情很完整，和人物的互动也很生动，刚开始玩任务线不是很容易，地图也有点晕乎，过了之后就恍然大悟，哇真的很有意思！！推荐！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198857842260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1657005958}
review: 剧情十分温馨可爱，很解压，游戏内容前后会有很多联系和小彩蛋，需要细心一点。游戏有探索解密的部分，又不缺乏战斗挑战，如果你喜欢Undertail，那么相信我，wuppo也不容错过！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198989002803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1667924731}
review: 打折后价格对应意想不到的完成度，构建出了一整套小世界，值得一试。

author: {'steamid': '76561198330864977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1703246206}
review:
I dont know why my play time count restarted but ever since i finished this game i've had a void in my heart, im alone my wife left me because i was "plain" as she described me in our last argument, and i had to refund the game before the sale so i could pay the child support that i owe. Im happy that i can play this game one more time staring at the bubbly characters of the game and listening to the funky music. i cant help but thoughtlessly stare at the floor with nothing left in my life. my life is ruined

im looking forward to the new wuppo game that will come out since its the only thing that i have in my life anymore since the only friend i had left me and got with my ex- wife. I must say they look very happy and he is playing a fatherly role to my only kid, but now im not allowed near my kid and i only have the child support to pay. I think they are going to get married soon and i cant help but miss her, it kinda reminds me of that scene in wuppo in that city where you meet a happy couple and you have to fight this needlessly funky and bubbly boss with strong powers xD xD.
I cant help but remember the funny and happy sounding music from the game whenever i go to the grocery store once a month. You know ever since i started paying child support it became harder and harder to support myself with the minimum wage i get from my 9 to 5. I hope they add multiplayer or co op so i can talk to people again and have fun. 
over all i like this game alot and im lucky to have found this hidden gem ever since it released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148681294', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1656352762}
review:
[h1] 累了就到巫姆之家休息一下吧 [/h1]

很别致的一款银河城。不同于一般的银河城用精巧的地图设计或是爽快的战斗吸引人，Wuppo强调的是一个轻松舒适的故事体验。整个游戏地图不大，流程也不长，开局一把胶枪，结束也还可以是这把胶枪；但是Wuppo展示了一个完整的小世界，有不同种类的生物，它们独特的生活方式，世界的原始力量乃至另一个位面的生灵，都在一个四脚小圆球的蹦蹦跳跳之间徐徐展开。游戏主要靠主线任务引导玩家探索，这些任务完成的方式往往都很独特，需要一定程度的解谜方能达成，所以boss战在本作中仅仅是锦上添花的效果，更多的时候还是沉浸在解谜和探索、体验这个世界的故事中；而整个故事还是能给人留下十分深刻的印象的。本作的音乐也十分到位，搭配剧情的推进整作玩下来心情还是相当闲适的，就算困难模式玩下来难度也并不大。游戏体量除去boss rush大概在8-10h左右，整体而言还是很合适的。

review:
通关了！！！（虽然还没有做到全成就）
很可爱的画风，除了没有引导没什么大问题。
游戏里面有自成一体的世界观，还有生物（我记不住他们的名字）开游乐场，但说实话一点也不刺激。唯一一个比较有意思的是弹弹跳的游戏，为了打破记录花了一点钱，等到了礼物！
boss难度不是很大，可以放心玩耍不怕卡关。
就是在波波城小吃店不能一次性选买多少吃的，要一个个买，有点麻烦。
总之是一次很好的游戏体验！

author: {'steamid': '76561199149608392', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1655577040}
review: 我可真的是太喜欢这个游戏了，丑丑的手绘2D画面别有一番风趣，粗略看去也是非常的可爱，优美多变的音乐，奇妙完善的世界观，可可爱爱的巫姆，价格又这么的便宜，没有不推荐的道理。要说美中不足的一点那可能就是这是一个弱引导的游戏，但是在瑞德达甫克莱茨的会客厅的解密太过复杂与混乱，我是查攻略一步一步才过的。童幼的画风下，是一个有些难度的应该算是类银河恶魔城风格的游戏吧，有这方面的味道，对小学生可能有些幼稚，但对我这个考试周的大二学生来说倒是刚刚好。真的是很推荐，玩起来也是很上头，操作简单，容易上手。推荐，推荐，推荐，这游戏就是有些冷门，网上的攻略都很少，不过用心也可以找到很详细的，真心希望更多人都能玩到这款游戏，相信你不会失望的。

review:
這是一款操作起來非常可愛的遊戲，然而有段時間沒玩，我搞不清楚自己究竟要怎麼繼續進行主線任務，這方面的提示要是能更清楚點就好了。
根據網路上的描述，要等主線破完，才能進行多人連線操作，不過最多兩人進行遠端連線。
要是能夠更自由一點進行連線，共同破任務就好了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198356448479', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1627377874}

author: {'steamid': '76561198404263943', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1644679228}
review:
4块钱买的游戏，游戏内容这不得超过40块了，厂家一定是在做慈善！

画风治愈，游戏内容比想象中丰富得多，世界很大，还出乎预料的自由。里面的npc十分独立，有自己的性格，有自己的事情，有自己的生物钟。你去找邻居要在他有空回家的时间段，钱钱要靠自己打工来赚，去游乐场玩游戏还要老实排队，跟在丸子大军里，不许插队哟。

物超所值！！可爱天花板，有属于自己的小boss，但是战斗难度不大，游戏剧情可以玩十几个小时，然后你可以在游戏里自由养老，和乌姆们一起，做任何你喜欢的事。

去这个游戏底下看看评价吧，你们会想买它的。

review: I am astounded that this game isnt 'overwhelmingly positive' in terms of reviews.  What an absolute hidden gem of a game, so cute, the art style is gorgeous, but it's woefully under appreciated.  It's a shame I cant play this now on Mac, but I would recommend everyone reading this to buy it.  Now.  I've just been playing TOEM and it reminded me of this and how much I loved it.  A really nice mix of puzzles and platforming, with a wide variety of lovely hats!

author: {'steamid': '76561198369504412', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1654933471}
review:
想先说一下wuppo的缺点！
    剧情引导可以做得更好些，很多地方其实是我误打误撞进去的，比如全知翁的地洞、乌姆之家的第五层、炮楼。鹦鹉（会说话的鸟应该是鹦鹉吧hhh）和小石头人的设定没有很好的用到，要是路过重要的隐藏地图可以适当的给一些小tips，比如走过后花园的水潭时，鹦鹉蹦出来说一句：“讨厌的水总是会弄湿我的羽毛”，也许会发现的快些，也会更有趣一些呢。
    剧情略微欠缺。幻灯片的设定我非常喜欢，可以通过探索完善和弥补世界观，可是未免也太少了一些吧hhh，即便通关了，我也才略微感知到作者想要传达种族和谐的观念，可是剧情上的支离破碎让我觉得传达得还不够好。从离开家---花狮人远征---波波城危机---天坑---图森空间，我很难发现贯穿这几大剧情得那根线，不管是逻辑上还是情感上，我都很难感受到剧情的连贯性和合理性。
    也许还有很多不足的地方，不过这并不影响我喜欢这个游戏！
    最最最喜欢的一点是在细节上的小惊喜，碰到的时候会让我咯咯咯的笑好久！比如花狮王和我说我殴打了他好几个子民，要赔偿的时候，我寻思着明明是你们先动手的吧！还有拿着波波通坐车的时候，是真的要按照时间表来，在列车里晃晃悠悠着等到达终点，非常有代入感。熬汤的那个厨师，在你走过的时候会被他的肚皮弹开，会让我觉得“莫非厨师的肚子都是这么大且有弹性”，以及剧情结束的时候我再去找卡洛，他会担忧地和我谈起是否要退休。
    我会被这些精心设计的细节所打动，就好像在酒吧里喝完一杯之后发现杯底有一枚戒指，扬起头发现对面的她笑盈盈地看着你等你做出反应。
    对啦，我最喜欢的角色就是卡洛！会每天给我送我最喜欢的冰淇淋，赶走我之后会愧疚，当我重新回来的时候又接纳我。所以在游戏的最后，我回到那个接待台，不厌其烦地在他面前按铃铛，和他道了最后一声别。
    我喜欢这个游戏，也许他的画风不是我喜欢的，也许很多地方还没有完善，也许在等车等到崩溃的时候会骂骂咧咧的（我等了整整十分钟车！），但是他给了我很享受的几个下午，让我短暂地在wuppo的世界里开心冒险。

author: {'steamid': '76561198886869599', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1652449227}
review:
[h1]真的！很！可！爱！很！好！玩！ [/h1]
因为一个冰淇淋被赶出wum之家 所以200币X  从大堂经理那里白嫖一张波波票√
每次不想等车自己徒步到一半的时候都会被反方向的列车撞掉血再给带回去
经常没看清路从空中掉下来 npc太多有时候会找不到自己 大号胶胶枪蓄力之后打出去十米之内人畜不分 谁都看不见
坐跳楼机的时候投币慢了会被插队 但不妨碍四脚汤圆成为一个拯救世界的wum！ 

最后希望买东西(倒买倒卖)的时候能手动选数量 一个个买点的我手指头要离家出走了 
（这款游戏可以送给女朋友 如果你有的话

author: {'steamid': '76561198896008720', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1712337082}
review:
Wuppo - наверняка лучшая с сюжетом, в которую я играл! Казалось бы, это простой платформер, но нет. В Wuppo множество интересных боссов, проработанная история  мира и рас, интересный и иногда сложные головоломки и СУПЕР МИЛАЯ графика. 

В Wuppo должен поиграть каждый блогер и игровой эксперт. 

В игре не просто используют доставший всех сюжет, а привносят что - то своё. Вот список имён и слов, которые не узнает человек, не игравший в Wupo: Блюссеры, Спленкхенккеры, Блайны, Вумы, Фнэккеры, Аллесветер, Бонко, смурт, спленккоин, фнейкбол, Тусеен. Этот список можно продолжать очень долго! Если кто - то думает, что это простая игрушка для детей, то вы ошибаетесь!

Также в игре очень хорошая музыка! Вроде она написана оркестром (Это не точно!). Мне очень понравилась мелодия Betty's Shop.

Хоть эту игру я и получил бесплатно от брата, но хочу ОЧЕНЬ СИЛЬНО похвалить разработчиков и переводчиков на русский за проделанный труд. Три дня я не отрывался от экрана. Когда - нибудь пройду Wuppo на сложности Hard или Insane. 

Спасибо за прочтение! Оценка этому шедевру 10/10! Wuppo надолго останется у меня в сердце.

author: {'steamid': '76561198982313080', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1628686866}
review:
키보드 유저는 마우스와 키보드를 동시에 써야한다는 점이 단점으로 남을 수 있음.

하지만 전체적으로 난이도가 높지 않은 편이고, 무엇보다 캐릭터가 너무 귀여움.

자잘한 미션이나 도전과제, 수집요소를 신경쓰지 않고 캐주얼하게 진행한다면
게임 진행이 조금 심플하게 느껴질 수 있다고 생각함.

젠장맞을 보스런 노업글 도전과제만 아니었어도
게임이 너무 재밌네 맵이 넓네 npc 상호작용이 디테일하네 등등 내내 찬양만 하다가 끝났을 게임.

npc와의 상호작용을 좋아하는 사람이라면 무조건 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015454363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1651999276}
review: 开发商还是把更新重心放在bug修复上吧，语言什么的都是小问题，各种游玩bug真心影响体验，比方说胶胶枪右摇杆瞄准时常失灵（用其他游戏测试过，不是手柄的问题），伤害图标经常大到把自己和敌人都盖住了，才玩了没两个小时，bug就已经出现了得有五六回了，十分影响游戏的推进体验，游戏确实是好游戏，能把bug修好就完美了

author: {'steamid': '76561198994313417', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1703319338}
review: 游戏很不错，对于这个价格来说绝对值，流程也不短，绝对够玩，游戏地图挺多的，无论是解密还是闯关都挺合我口味，就是游戏内的引导太少了，大多数情况都是自己探索自己查攻略去完成全收集，如果是跟朋友一起玩，2p的操控的这只鸟，游戏体验不如1p，不过远程畅玩不会断开，比ea的好多了，随便骂一句，傻呗ea

author: {'steamid': '76561198028706136', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1615636784}
review:
- ŚLICZNA i przeurocza gra, absolutnie uwielbiam jej setting i stworzony w niej świat, szczególnie miasteczko fabryczne zostało świetlnie stworzone i wręcz tętni życiem, podobnie jak wesołe miasteczko; natomiast wszystkie lokacje pomiędzy tymi metropoliami pełnymi stworków są puste xD
- mega design postaci i wrogów, bossy są głupkowate i fajnie się z nimi walczy
- fabuła bardzo przyjemna i prawie do samego końca jest super przyjemna i na luzie, natomiast na koniec przyjmuje nieco poważniejszy wydźwięk, który mi osobiście się nie podoba, bo wolałbym, żeby ta gra była utrzymana w takim lekkim klimacie, a nie wchodziła na poziomy mistyczne, ezoteryczne i filozoficzne xD podobnie było z turnip boyem właśnie
- cała reszta kompletnie na plus, bo jest zabawna, ładne lokacje, klan lwów jest głupkowaty i niepoprawny gramatycznie, za co go kocham, genialnie wykreowany świat i humorek

author: {'steamid': '76561199073877680', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1640507145}
review:
我太蠢了，当初买是为了跟对象一起玩
然后买完才发现只能一台电脑一起玩
然后由于我能力有限玩了一会就玩不明白了
看他全程通关了
这个游戏做的是真的不错
剧情以及游戏里面的小游戏都挺有趣
推荐大家打折的情况下入手
因为指引性真的有点差
解密难度不高但是容易找不到路
原价购入容易落灰
但是总体来说真的挺不错的
连他这个不喜欢解密嫌麻烦的
都说这个游戏做的挺不错的
我觉得喜欢解密的朋友可以放心入手

author: {'steamid': '76561199162543880', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1696331760}
review: Dieses Spiel ist meiner Meinung nach sehr gelungen. Am Anfang wird man einer Art Hotel geworfen und muss wieder hinein kommen, doch man darf man, im Hotel wieder angekommen, nicht mehr als zwei Tage wohnen. Also geht es im Spiel, darum einen neuen Wohnort zu finden. Auf der Suche nach einem neuen Wohnort, findet man viele neue Freunde und muss gegen detailreiche Bosse kämpfen. Besonders gelungen ist die Story, weil sogenannte Filmstreifen, überall in der Welt passend verteilt sind, sie sind sehr interessant, helfen dir das Spiel besser zu verstehen und die ...weter  (z.B. Allesweter) (die ...weter sind weise Leute mit Projektoren)  geben dir, weil sie es interessant finden, oft auch noch SMURT dazu (SMURT ist die Währung). Das Spiel nicht zu vergessen lustig und die Musik ist auch sehr gelungen. Es gibt noch viel mehr was ich erwähnen würde, aber ich will nicht weiter spoilern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842536446', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1652786894}
review:
可爱的画风，欢快的音乐，诙谐的剧情
看似是廉价的“小游戏”，实际上却有着丰富的内容
流程约10+小时，融合了探索、战斗、解谜和收集等多种元素
丰富的对话与各种幻灯片，构造出一个精致的乌托邦世界，是一个合格的恶魔城游戏。
幸福值即为血条，而增加上限的方式是做一些让我们的主角乌姆感到幸福的事。正如幸福总会在无意中到来，像辛苦排队乘坐了次过山车、得到了伙伴的鼓励、泡了会热水澡、收集完一个区域所有录像带、吃了一块美味的蛋糕……快乐就是这么简单。伴随着乌姆满足的笑脸和幸福+1的提示，仿佛自己也得到了幸福。[strike] 然而后来查攻略想全收集100幸福值的我很痛苦 x[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198329245030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1649157921}
review:
雖然標籤中有"類銀河戰士惡魔城"，但其實是一款很有生活感的遊戲
遊玩的過程中不會明顯告訴你主線該怎麼推進，但這在前中期反而能讓你好好跟其他角色互動以及融入這個世界的生活中
但是到遊戲後期就變得有點煩躁了，因為後期很明顯就是要你推進主線而不是閒閒地亂晃，毫無頭緒的狀況下只能查攻略通關
整體來說還是個很用心的作品

author: {'steamid': '76561197963534491', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1647989038}
review:
Wuppo is kind of difficult for me to describe because it really is its own thing. One of the press blurbs on this Steam page for is is a quote from PCGamer stating, "Wuppo, the most overlooked 'hidden gem' on Steam." That feels like an accurate sentiment, hyperbole aside.

It's a fun little platformer with some shooting and almost Metroidvania elements to it, as well as a small open-ish world to explore with a carnival, a few towns, and plenty of hidden little secrets. You can visit shops to customize and dress up your protagonist and upgrade your tools or just buy useless silly things. It's light-hearted and fun, giving kind of a warm fuzzy feeling to the whole thing. It's almost a childlike wonderment.

I honestly have had significant difficulty figuring out how best I want to summarize and review Wuppo and I think I have to give in and say: Wuppo is a fun warm and fuzzy game with some light platforming, a small but fun world to explore, and engaging experience. I finished it in roughly 6 hours and in that time I enjoyed every moment of the game. I only finished with around 57% of the game completed and having missed 5 of the optional bosses so if you're looking for even more it's there to be found.

I sincerely with a smile on my face recommend Wuppo and cannot precisely pin down why. More a feeling than a thought, and Wuppo feels great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275764871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1649711951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137513791', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1647214764}
review:
I can't quite pinpoint to what is it that makes this game different from other metroidvanias that I have played. My only guess would be that this is one of the few that actually tries (and it is successful at that) to build an interesting and unique world. It's not only about ability gating and upgrades, but it's also love and interest about the world's characters, and, in general, how this world came to be. 

Even if it becomes a little bit too nonsensical in the end, it never overstays its welcome, and manages to get most of the things right. Although everything is fictional, it's more real and human than most of the games I have played. Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989280149', 'num_games_owned': 2540, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1625447689}
review:
This was certainly impressive. The world is very lively, and it does not feel like it revolves around you. Folks run around, jumping up and down, buying stuff at shops, working, etc. Many areas are completely optional, some quite out of the way, and the characters are usually charming even when being pricks. :D

Gameplay is mostly fun too. It isn't quite a "metroidvania", but the game has a plethora of "wearable" objects which can be used in all sorts of situations. Downsides: a couple of items are not explained -- not as much as in "where to use this" (I love to discover such mechanics), but as in "what buttons do I press to get this going"; and, well, waiting for public transportation is not a fun game mechanics. But all in all, an enjoyable game and clearly a labor of love.

Score: 78/100.

author: {'steamid': '76561199202669170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1645543682}
review:
Cute animation, but the controls for keyboard and controller are horrible and awkward. 
it is not a metroidvania or really even a platformer and yet it is marketed as such. 
It is just a 2d rpg. The 2 player function is really bad and it seems you need to use that to get some of the achievements. Really cute game and idea.....but it rubs me the wrong way that they called it a metroidvania. It's not in any way shape or form a metroidvania or honestly even a platformer. It's just a small rpg. 
The animation style makes it difficult to see where you can or can't go, and the screen transitions are just awful. Not worth the money even though I am interested in what these developers do next.. I just hope they market their product accurately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075863895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1644503322}
review:
귀엽게 만들긴 했는데 버그도 많고 불만도 많아요.

미신중에 길찾기나 설명이 불친절했고 지도는 있으나마나고 진행하는데도 아무 관련 없어 보이던 사이드 퀘스트가 메인이랑 이어지게 만들어 놓은건 좀;;;

제일 거슬리게 한 부분은 내가 피해를 입거나 큰 피해를 줬는데 화면의 거의 1/3을 채운 데미지 표시가 화면을 가려버리는 거였죠.
내가 어디있는지 적이 어디 있는지 다 가려버리니까 난이도가 급상승 하네요.

그래도 세계관도 재밌고 이것저것 신경쓴 요소도 먾고 재밌게 즐긴 것 같아서 추천합니다.

도시로 넘어간 후 팁 드리자면 신문배달 알바 할때 주는 배달 복장이 피해량이 엄청 쌔고 충전도 NPC대화하면서 신문이나 포스터로 채워주니까 요긴하게 써먹으시면 될 것 같네요

author: {'steamid': '76561199087447834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 2936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1680840788}
review:
Ah, Wuppo. I've played this game a couple of times and it is certainly one of my utmost favourites. A lot of times with games they're not as good the second time around, much less third and so on, however with Wuppo it's always seemed to be just as good every time I play it. There's a lot of awesome stuff about it, more than I could neatly fit into this review.

For starters, it features some of the best world-building I've ever seen. The places have a feel to them, a mood that is similar to how real life places sometimes have a mood, their own personality that you can feel. Plus the inhabitants of the world often have their own things they are doing, going about their business as if you were indeed just another stranger. All of the characters feel real and interesting in their own way, and everything you encounter makes sense to be there. Take for example bosses: a lot of times in games you may find a boss at some place and it makes sense why they are in that location, but not really why they are there at that time, or what they were doing before you got there, they just exist and you defeat them. In Wuppo all of the bosses contextually made sense and fit perfectly into the story, while also being engaging to fight. I just love how creative the game is, and how all of these great things together really make you feel a part of the world. 

Then there's the cute, endearing artstyle of the game. I haven't seen any games (apart from An Untitled Story) that feature a look like this. The way it is all wobbly and fuzzy and cute, I love it! Its broad selection of palettes brings joy to my heart. Also, I should mention that the funpack for this game has a Wuppo science video, and it is glorious.

On a different note, there is also the delightful soundtrack, which compliments the moods and events happening in the game, while also being great to listen to on its own. There are some particularly fresh tunes from the game's radio (because Wuppo has its very own radio station), which I listen to regularly. Speaking of nice sounds, one thing that really helps to sell the world of Wuppo is the ambience. Whether it's the sound of a tram leaving or just the local critters, having all that happening makes the world feel lively and rich, I love simply being in it.

The worst part about Wuppo is that I bought it on sale ;o; (         WHY!!?                           WHYYYYYYY?!!!!!). Do not make the same mistake as I did, dear reader; If the game is on sale, don't buy it, wait till it's full price. To close off, in the words of Bufter, "Buy Wuppo and you will be very happy."

author: {'steamid': '76561198858955754', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 3915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1281, 'playtime_at_review': 1850, 'last_played': 1711986653}
review: 超级喜欢！超级可爱！超级治愈！可恶我也好想变成一只小乌姆...总之就是非常值得一玩！类银河恶魔城里清新脱俗的暖心小甜品~收集要素丰富且有趣，音效及配乐到位，彩蛋很多，世界观完整，剧情无厘头但温暖。地图蛮大，跑图是类银河恶魔城的必备了。没有困难的平台跳跃，但有略困难的解谜要素，卡关就查查攻略so easy啦。boss战难度不高但设计得也不错，游戏开始时可以选难度，简单难度下即使是没有操作的小白也不会在战斗部分卡关。boss run模式好评，很适合有操作、喜欢挑战的玩家，可玩性大大提升。全成就很难，全成就党需注意（如果是操作很强的大佬的话当我没说）。于我个人我是觉得原价不亏，史低血赚，基本上是一款可以带给你惊喜的佳作，打折就只需要无脑入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100355528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1641813947}
review: Rather hard, but nonetheless one of the better games I have played recently. Wuppo is a completely unique experience that I would recommend to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561199081133842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1684736194}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993475161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1641766613}
review:
I really didn't expect to spend so much time on this game.
 This is a full on 2D Metroidvania with tons of characters and quests and dialogue. The gameplay itself is passable, but just the variety of locations, and situations you get thrown into is fun. 
Quests can vary from a gladiator fight to saving cooks from their own creation to becoming a paper boy in a city to solving puzzles in a haunted ancient ruin to evicting uncooperative tenants to diving deep underwater to fight a sea monster. This game really goes places, it's a bit surreal thinking back at it all now. 

Especially the first 5 mins of the game are hilarious, tho I felt the first half of the game was quite barren story wise but it picked up again later in the game. So you do need some patience with the game. 

The races, lore, and even the origin story of the world are actually really consistent and encourage exploration and even theorycrafting. 

The inventory is a clunk fest, especially the further you get in the game and the more items you carry. And the controller support has a bug where sometimes it just likes to shoot to the left randomly which is a shame cause otherwise it's perfectly controller friendly. So ye, gotta use Mouse and Keyboard. 
 There's also so much to keep track off if you would want to 100% this game. There is no log for side quests and so keeping track of those is entirely up to the player and you are really bombarded with story from all sides sometimes it's very hard not to get overwhelmed. 
It may be a Metroidvania but sometimes you're literally spending an hour in a town just talking to people ;D
Not sure if the average Metroidvania fan appreciates that. But you can skip some NPCs and locations which is what I did, especially Wondersplenk. It was too much lol

Different, but good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077506819', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1583692179}

author: {'steamid': '76561198129052600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1641100315}
review:
Very mediocre experience overall.
It starts out promising, but the more you get into it the more you start to realize that the game isn’t gonna do anything with the gameplay mechanics it sets up, and the game is just overall a fetch quest.
The Metroidvania tags on the store page are not truthful in the slightest, it doesn't have any of the metroidvania hallmarks, like getting new upgrades and stuff. The only kinda metroidvania thing it has is exploring a big world.
I’m not exactly disappointed, I took a risk when I bought the game, but my money would definitely have been better spent on something else.
My expectations were pretty average, and those expectations were met.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054576246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1654432267}
review: only just scratched the surface, but seems like a classic.  It might look like it is for children, but there is actually a wee learning curve with depth, lore, platforming, and puzzle solving.  It is cool how there are fully populated cities that feel like they are really alive, and the NPCs are all super funny.  it really should be played by everyone, unless u r some sorta pvp only freak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015326061', 'num_games_owned': 1980, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1640906790}
review:
[b][u]This game was reviewed using Version 1.0.37. Your experience on future versions may vary.[/u][/b]

[h3][b][u]Short Answer:[/u][/b][/h3] An underrated metroidvania filled to the brim with content, though not always the best at guiding you through it all. With a great visual style, expansive soundtrack, and at least 7-8 hours of main story story content alone, it's well worth its $15 price tag even if you aren't pushing for 100% completion.

[b][u]NOTE[/u]: This game comes with a bit of an [u]epilepsy warning[/u], as some sequences have rapid flashing visuals that cannot be disabled. For a detailed explanation, see below.[/b]

[h3][b][u]Long Answer:[/u][/b][/h3] [i]Wuppo[/i] is a metroidvania game about a little 'Wum' who travels the world in search of a new home, and gets involved in a bunch of shenanigans along the way. [b]The game juggles a healthy mix of platforming, combat, and puzzle solving, and it balances it all very well[/b], making sure that none of these gameplay elements feel underdeveloped. Along with a decent-sized main story to run through, [b]the game is chock-full of secrets and side content[/b] to keep you busy, and nearly all of them provide a reward worth your time if you choose to pursue them. All of this is made more fun to run through thanks to the [b]wide range of colorful characters[/b] that populate the game, making sure every new area you visit provides you with a unique experience. Top things off with a [b]charming hand-drawn art style[/b] reminiscent of Paper Mario series, as well as a a [b]large and pleasant soundtrack[/b] throughout, and you've got a game that's almost certain to give you a good time.

Good as it is, though, it's not without its problems. While being filled with content is certainly a positive thing, [i]Wuppo[/i] occasionally struggles to guide the player through it. [b]It doesn't always do the best job at steering you in the right direction[/b], both for secrets and story content, so you may find yourself running around in circles or consulting a walkthrough if you miss a stray piece of dialogue that hints at where to go next. Post-release patches have alleviated this issue somewhat (especially for completionists), but still doesn't always get it right, so don't blame yourself if you wind up getting stuck every once in a while. For those opting for 100% completion, also know that you'll almost definitely need to spend time grinding for money; and doing so is a slog no matter how you approach it, as even the fan-discovered money farming tricks still take a long time. It's not a huge issue, but [b]the need to grind for money made 100% completion drag in some parts more than I would have liked[/b].

At the start of this review, I said that [b]this games comes with an unofficial [u]epilepsy warning[/u][/b], as some parts of it involve sequences of bright, flashing lights and/or strobe effects that cover the entire screen and cannot be avoided or disabled during your playthrough. They don't always come with much warning before they happen, so I've outlined where in the game these take place, and what to look out for to signal that they're about to happen. Obviously, some spoilers ahead:
[list]
[*]Early game: [spoiler]The first major boss of the game is this giant stone idol, and its death animation--which occurs once he runs out of health and starts floating towards the center of the chamber--causes the screen to quickly flash white for a couple seconds.[/spoiler]

[*]Late game: [spoiler]Once you reach the bottom of Redav Kned's Guest House, the underground ruins under Bliekopolis, you'll find an altar with five pedestals, and you need to place food on all five of them to activate it. Doing so summons a spirit with a very bright light and some minor strobe effects that slowly build in intensity for a bit. This sequence happens again a little later, albeit with a bit less intensity.[/spoiler]

[*]Late game: [spoiler]After you summon the spirit a second time, it gives you something called a Warp Mask. Each use of the mask requires you to hold the Use button as a random sequence of symbols starts to strobe quickly across the screen. It's probably the least intense of the visuals here, but gets a warning just to be safe.[/spoiler]

[*]Final boss: [spoiler]Just as the final boss fight is coming to an end, bright flickering lights will appear randomly across the screen as a character is summoned to deliver the final blow. The cutscene that follows contains an extremely intense sequence of bright flashing lights and strobe effects, bad enough that it could strain your eyes even if you aren't at risk of epileptic seizures. If you reach this point and you are at risk, fight normally until the last bubble of light (next to the boss's health) begins to drain--the music will pick up in intensity and you'll notice flickering lights come into view once the sequence is starting. Eat a health item if you can (as the boss will keep firing), then look away from the screen and keep pushing the A button until the white noise that accompanies the cutscene stops and the game goes near silent.[/spoiler]
[/list]
This isn't an exhaustive list of "epilepsy warning" sequences, just ones that caught my eye while I was playing, so feel free to let me know if I missed anything. These aren't something that would make me tell people to avoid this game altogether, but they should come with some kind of in-game warning beforehand, or means to disable the effects altogether.

For my save file on normal difficulty, [b]it took me about 7 hours to beat the main story, and another 6-7 hours to reach 100% file completion[/b]--and that's not including the time I could spend beating the game on harder difficulties or the Boss Run mode you unlock in the post-game. While the game had its ups and downs, I found myself enjoying the game much more often than not. [b][u][i]Wuppo[/i] is an overall charming game that's packed with content, and it's well worth the $15 price tag for how much you can get out of it.[/u][/b] What Knuist & Perzik made could certainly be considered an underrated gem, and I hope that time will bring more deserved recognition to this game as well as their future endeavors.

[quote]For more game reviews, check out my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42524563/]Curator page[/url]![/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198416441500', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1640342770}
review:
太好玩了，本来是当个小小休闲游戏打折入手的，因为画风看起来就非常的简陋，导致我忽略它这么久！我真是超级惊讶!前两天因为无聊打算玩点简单无脑游戏放松一下，没想到一下子穿越到这个光怪陆离的巫姆世界了！！！

有隐藏，有增加幸福点，有武器升级，地图超多，展开的副线也多，奇奇怪怪的小人物，还有主线探索，一整个把我诱惑住了！怎么会这么好玩！这性价比也太高了！

操作方面不难，不过手残的朋友还是耐心点。解谜有的地方真的会卡关！比如天坑关卡的会客厅，大概打了有一个小时！

里面的等车真的和现实生活的烦躁相差无几好不好，我调整电脑时间都没用！无语。不过也是一个特色了。

这个游戏我一定要通关，然后来写通关感言。

现在已经有汉化了，玩到现在没有什么bug，打折又超级便宜，快冲快来喜加一！不亏!

author: {'steamid': '76561199057340273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1701950788}
review: Great game! I really like how the world feels alive with all the npcs that wander about. Though there are a bunch of instances where waiting is involved which is usually a couple of minutes and might annoy some people, but it's not that bad usually. Also puzzles could get quite frustrating when you don't know what you're doing but this game just requires a bit of patience. The story is quite simple but charming regardless, same goes for the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198846007210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1638439863}
review:
如果是和我一样，喜欢像《地下传说》和早期宝可梦这类剧情风趣幽默，具有完整世界观的同时可以在游戏里满世界冒险的玩家
不要犹豫，一定要试试看这部《巫姆泡泡》

在这个世界里，你不但可以像寻常游戏那样四处解密、打怪、收集和改造你的武器，还可以去游乐园、坐电车、进城当打工人然后顺便解救城市（、团结不和的种族关系，最终拯救世界！
而且可能因为是老游戏了，打折力度很大，对游戏没底的玩家可以等打折再买。

游戏的优点：
1，完整的世界观，可爱的角色
2，幽默的对话剧情，丰富的收集与隐藏要素
3，种类繁多，使用有趣的道具
4，可供挖掘的有趣支线剧情

游戏的缺点：
1，地图较小，只有3个大地图，大概10小时就可以通关了（想达成全成就的话当然时间会更长点）
            而其中的波波城属于要素最多，却也是最容易浪费时间的地图。要打比方的话就是回合制JRPG，只不过JRPG需要你练级，而波波城则是需要你赚钱。
            像我尽管已经掌握了倒卖刷钱这一卑鄙手段，但还是经不住琐碎操作所带来的精神污染，刷一半就又回去跑地图了...
2，藏木于林，一到“人”多的地方，就立刻消失的主角
             主角设计和路人们一样。如果不顶个显眼的外装，一旦身处人群中玩家那是根本分不清自己在哪里的
3，严格遵守时间的交通工具。
             在没有开启传送门前，玩家在波波城和乌姆之家两个大地图之间移动是需要交通工具的。然而，这些列车却不以玩家需要来运作，所以，就，等吧...
4，较糟糕的引导。
             开头还好，等进入波波城及之后的地图游戏引导就不行了，往往需要玩家舔地图才能发现并开启支线或主线。不过某种意义上也算自由度开发吧，可以以自己的步调玩游戏。
5，垃圾地图标示。
            有小地图，但属于聊胜于无的那种，还是得玩家自己背地图。
6，比较糟糕的翻译。
           听说试玩版翻译挺好的，但我玩的版本不时会有机翻夹杂其中。所幸不影响剧情理解。

虽然抱怨了这么多，但如果不是真心喜欢哪里会这么挑剔呢！！（
而且以上缺点总的来说也不算太影响游戏体验，大家都来试试看吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561199019487643', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1636134383}
review:
귀여운 감성의 아기자기한 2d 게임을 좋아한다면 추천함.
보스 난이도도 나쁘지 않은 수준이며 구경거리가 많고, 나름의 퍼즐요소도 갖춤.
허나 뚜렷한 목표가 정해져있지 않고 길을 직접 찾아다녀야 하기 때문에 불필요한 플레이가 길어지며
게임이 루즈해진다는 점이 마이너스가 되겠음.
지하도시에서 집 구하려다 세계를 구하고 싶은 사람이라면 추천함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026663817', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1574464981}
review:
Wuppo is a fun metroidvania about finding a place to live. It has great art style, amazing music, fun worldbuilding and writing. But that's not why I'm recommending it. I'm doing that because this game triggered some kind of mystical revelation within me.

Let me try to explain why. The game's setting, characters, music, and the combination thereof create this very strong feeling of being in a living, breathing world. Getting lost in Popo City, waiting at the train station, lazing about in the Wumhouse. This is not a game board that exists for you to play in, it's a world that you just happen to be a part of. And this is a world that welcomes you, that loves you - even if you disagree sometimes.

It's a very optimistic game. There are conflicts, there is danger, but in the end the game whispers "it will all be okay" into your ear - and you believe it. 

Everything else, the gameplay, the plot, they're all just means with which the game conveys its optimism. As such, they almost tend to blend in. That's a good thing, though - it 'flows', so you never have those 'oh, it's a game' moments. Which is all we can ask for, really. If you ever played Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door, you probably have an idea what I'm talking about, except it's much stronger here.

Oh, and before I played this, I was roughly aware of this game and it seemed generic and uninteresting (wacky funny creatures? yaaawn). I was so, so wrong. I implore you: do not make the same mistake as I did. Play Wuppo. It will change your life. And if it won't, you'll at least play a pretty decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332609077', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1597812571}

author: {'steamid': '76561199006573664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1637689520}
review:
정말 정말 순수한 재미만을 담은 귀여운 겜.. 쏴죽이고 터트리는 게임에 익숙해져있다가 간만에 진짜 힐링하는 기분이 들었다~

author: {'steamid': '76561198989051349', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1636652023}
review: Wuppo is such a special game to me, it is one of those rare games that effortlessly immerses you into its world with brilliant and funny dialogue, incredible exploration, and charming puzzles with brief intermissions of tense combat. This game is relentlessly enjoyable with some of the funniest, most memorable characters I’ve ever seen in a game brought to life by the whimsical and endearing art style and amazing soundtrack which gave every area a distinct atmosphere and mood. This is the most I’ve been invested in an indie game’s world since Hollow Knight and the number of details in the world is stupidly high like a real-time transportation system and unique dialogue based on when you encounter them. It progresses like a mix of a Metroidvania and a classic JRPG with a heavy emphasis on environmental puzzles, dialogue, exploration, and bullet hell boss battles. Due to this variety this game’s main quest never really gets old and the pacing is pretty damn good as a result. Exploration is encouraged with the vast amount of side quests, bosses, and collectibles with a great progression system and almost perfectly designed economy with Popocity being the location where the stars align with great exploration, puzzles, bosses, and dialogue. This is honestly such an amazing game and one of the best indies I’ve ever played, while it does have some polishing missteps, they are pretty negligible and it doesn't drag the game down. I never would have bought this game in a million years if not for a very special recommendation from someone so I’m telling you now that you should play this game, it already holds such a special place in my heart and is one of my favorite games and probably the funniest game I’ve ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561199100730119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1636347810}
review:
战斗的时候看不清自己在哪。画面切换会导致跳空。后面解谜很多，机关不明显，不看攻略你很难想到看着像墙的东西能移动。班克伦特先吓你再气你。
      但是游戏音乐很好，画风独特，故事不错，折后价格低。物种丰富，环境多样，有城市，有高山，有海洋，有神庙。总之推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561199175489196', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1696082785}
review:
游戏真的很可爱但是这个导航也太迷了，，3个小时有快两个小时都在找地方以及来回跑（又吞我时长），去河道找一个东西完全找不到，也没有多少提示。我大部分的主线任务触发都是靠阴差阳错碰到或者看攻略，不看着攻略玩真的很累，只能说幸好我是4块打折买的吧，还有一点小bug，比如对话按不动，后面去监狱放人我重进才拉的开牢门，总之画风可爱但不是很推荐，打折买比较好
二编：
呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜呜通关了这个游戏真的非常可爱呜呜呜呜呜呜呜结局我真的很感动
游戏很不错就是要配合攻略食用

author: {'steamid': '76561198117775085', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1962, 'last_played': 1636013636}
review:
귀여운 털뭉치가 되어 세계를 구해보세요! 어렵지 않아 가볍게 즐길 수 있는 게임입니다.
아래는 제가 겪은 버그 하나 써놨습니다.
[spoiler] 게임에 총 모을 수 있는 행복이 100개인데, 아무리 공략을 보고 처음부터 따라해도 99개에서 더 올라가질 않았습니다. 그렇게 돌아다니다가 우연히 포포시티에서 전차에 치였는데 갑자기 잠깐 렉걸리고 웜하우스 3층에 있는 바트할아버지? 옛날 이야기 해주면서 행복 5개 주는 웜 앞으로 순간이동 되더니 대화가 진행되고 몇시간 동안 찾아 해맨 마지막 행복을 받았습니다. 이게 무슨... [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198319585895', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1635940201}
review:
What I enjoy about this game:
[list]
[*] Adorably cute graphics and excellent soundtrack and sound effects.
[*] Most locations in the Wuppo world are joyful to explore.
[*] NPCs in most locations just take care of their own business without being disturbed by the presence of our protagonist. It really gives me the feeling of blending in and being one of the community of this wonderful Wuppo world.
[*] Tons of heart-warming/funny side quests/dialogues/interaction with the NPCs.
[*] Tons of save points, especially before and after each boss or difficult-to-get places.
[*] Filmstrips spread throughout the map tell a coherent and vivid background story of the Wuppo world.
[*] You need to queue up for [spoiler]theme park (the Wondersplenk) attractions and entrance to the city (the Popocity)[/spoiler]. You also need to wait for [spoiler]trains, trams, and the fall of night for certain quests[/spoiler]. I know that many players hate this, but I find it to be a nice touch, since it makes the Wuppo world feel even more immersive.
[*] No missable collectibles/locations/achievements.
[/list]

What I don't like or even hate about this game:
[list]
[*] Certain locations or collectibles require performing precision platform actions. This makes the game less casual than it should be.
[*] Boss fights are not very interesting, especially the final one.
[*] The first (the Wumgarden) and the last final location (the Sinkhole) are quite boring to explore.
[*] The final puzzle [spoiler](Redav Kned's Guesthouse)[/spoiler] is notoriously difficult. It is mostly nonsensical and is supposed (according to the devs) to be solved by trial and error.
[*] The game does not give enough guidance on how to progress. You have to explore every nook of a location and interact with each NPC to have a clearer idea about what is going on and what the game needs you to do. I have to frequently rely on guides and walkthrough.
[*] Some achievements require farming or RNG events and therefore are really grinding to get.
[*] The game does not display correctly when you change resolution.
[/list]

To be honest, I almost rage-quit and refund the game at the beginning when I wandered in a mostly empty location (the Wumgarden), jumping up and down in the jungle, avoiding thorns, and dying a couple of times without meeting a new NPC. Consider that I got the game 92% off, I decided to keep it and to press on. Well, my effort pays off when the game just gets better and better after the garden. The story and the world progressively unfold and the game becomes really intriguing.

Overall, I do not regret the dozen of hours I spent on this game, and I strongly recommend it to other players. Just a little caveat: do not expect to rush through this game; otherwise you cannot reap any pleasure from it. This game certainly has a similar vibe to A Short Hike, another great casual exploration & adventure game. Be patient and play it casually, then you will experience the joy of being a wum in the Wuppo world.

review: The game would be quirky and fun enough for me to recommend it, if not for several nitpicks like bugs which force you to reload, such as somehow managing to noclip inside an elevator and be unable to get out, or be carried upwards in a bubble while a character is talking and miss their dialogue. The game also has a day/night cycle and tries to make the world look like it's alive, which is pretty cool, but with how difficult it is to travel that felt more like an inconveince to me.

review: I was on the fence but overall I regret the time I spent playing Wuppo. I admit it is original and creative, however in many instances this felt like it is wasting my time for the sake of being quirky. Nonetheless, a refreshing take on platformer adventures with a hint of metroidvania. Collectables were too many for me to care.

review: This game is so wonderfully charming. It's not too difficult and the gameplay never gets too complicated, but the creators do such a good job of creating these squishy love-able characters, I feel it more than makes up for it. Feels very much like that old An Untitled Story game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198426640363', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1691889692}
review: Ever heard of the term; "Hidden Gem" ? Yeah, this is a god-tier example of one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144081330', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1633446762}
review: Cool little gem. The writing is sharp and charming, controls are tight, there is a nice amount of worldbuilding and lore but it's still a very light-hearted experience. I really liked the open-endedness presented here in some parts of the game (especially the city chapter), the game doesn't hold your hands and instead nudges you in the general direction of your objective, which can be completed in more ways than one. This and the fact the world feel lived in, with many other inhabitants going about their day and a real-time transportation system, set the game apart from the gazillion cute indie platformers on the market

author: {'steamid': '76561198800196353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 3798, 'last_played': 1711251389}
review:
앗! 우연히 세상을 구해버렸다! 가 매인적인 귀여운 게임
캐릭터들 대부분이 하찮고 귀엽다. 앤딩 5번 넘으니까 보스도 귀여워 보임
게임의 엔딩을 보고 난 후에도 게임 진행하면서 꼼꼼히 콘탠츠를 즐긴 대단한 분들 아니면 끝나도 할게 많은 게임 (히든보스,행복,필름 등) 만약 할로윈 시즌 할게 없다면 접속해보자 (할로윈 아이템을 구할수도?)  만약 이 리뷰를 보는 당신이 하도 게임을 해서 맵을 외울 정도로 게임을 많이했다면 하드코어 모드를 해보자! 전채적인 도전과제도 안 어렵기 때문에 만약 도전과제 컬랙터라면 꼭! 세일할떄 사시길 바랍니다. 후속작도 나온다는데 기대하셔도 나쁠건 없습니다!
마지막으로
 . . . -귀엽다는 이유만으로도 사셔도 손해 볼 껀 없습니다-

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1632834359}
review:
Spielwertung: 7/10

Ein Spiel wie ein Splenhakker!

Wuppo ist ein tolles Indiespiel (kann man das noch sagen oder schon "zu" populär???), das davon lebt, dass sich die zwei Hauptpersonen hinter dem Projekt eine tolle Geschichte mit völlig verrückten, komplett phantastischen und gezeichneten Figuren ausgedacht haben. 

Der Beginn des Spiels ist flott, fühlt sich gut an und der Fortschritt geht voran, im Mittelteil verliert Wuppo aber sehr stark an Flow. Das Spiel ist wie die Achterbahn der Splenhakker. Sie erreicht ein Tief, die Längen sind zu lang, werden nicht gefüllt, man hat das Gefühl, dass alle tollen Sachen viel zu teuer sind, man weiß nicht intuitiv was "gut" und was "nutzlos" ist, die Transport- und Laufwege sind langweilig und sobald man einmal feststeckt, gibt es kaum Hilfe. Die Community hat wieder tolle Guides geschrieben, aber sie sind nicht ganz "wasserdicht" und im Netz gibt es auch keine guten Komplettlösungen, Walkthroughs oder Youtube-Videos, obwohl es nicht völlig an Versuchen mangelt. 

Irgendwann fragt man sich vielleicht, wohin dieses Spiel führen will und ob es sich noch lohnt weiterzumachen. Zum Glück nimmt es dann im letzten Drittel noch mal Fahrt auf und die Motivation steigt wieder spürbar an, Das Ende kommt schließlich fast etwas überraschend. Obwohl nichts Spektakuläres mehr passiert, ist man sogar geneigt den vollen Abspann anzuschauen, was ich kaum bei den meisten Games mache und schließlich kann man noch mal in Ruhe reflektieren. Ja, es gibt noch einiges zu tun, noch manches zu finden und sogar den ein oder anderen Boss zu besiegen, aber letztlich hat man "The End" gesehen und fühlt sich gut, das Spiel im Guten zur Seite zu legen.

Fazit: Knappe 9 Stunden Story, aus denen sicher auch 7, aber auch 10, 12, 15 hätten werden können, in denen man erst sehr gut, dann etwas weniger gut und schließlich wieder sehr gut unterhalten wird. Oder, um das Spiel mit einem Wort zusammenzufassen: WUPPO!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986527965', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1632398711}
review:
Wuppo is a good game with a flawed design.

You're a wum. A messy wum. You get kicked out of your apartment because you're a messy goon. You then spend the first quarter of the game attempting to get back into your apartment. I'm not going to bother describing anything else that happens in the game because it's simply too difficult to describe what's happening in this game.

Where Wuppo excels is that it is an incredibly unique/creative game. It's cute and charming. The boss fights are well done. Dialogue ranges from well done and humorous to slow and plodding... which also describes the pacing of the game. You're going to be exploring for most of it and having no idea what's going on or what you're doing.

Wuppo's main issue is that it was designed poorly. The menus are a hassle. The controls are a bit awkward as well but you get used to them over time and they're not terrible, just awkward. 

The game has a map you can pull up to get around, but it's not particularly helpful in helping you navigate a lot of the time since rooms don't show where they connect. There's also no quick travel points... until you get to the very end of the game just before the final boss. This isn't a big deal as you don't need to backtrack very often, but it's weird that they threw in a quick travel system but don't give you access to it until the very end of the game.

The game has puzzles and there are a couple that are obscure for no real reason. They're not hard, simply placing objects on pedestals, but they're needlessly cryptic. 

I see some people complain about parts with waiting and while that might be bad if true, there's only one part you actually have to wait and sit around. That's for a train that takes you underground. Once you go underground, you don't need to come back up. So it's one segment and there's even a clock showing you when it's going to arrive so you can go off and do something else until it shows up, which isn't that long in the first place. I don't remember there being any other part in the game that requires waiting around. Every other part with waiting, such as getting in lines at the theme park, are 100% optional.

Wuppo is above average to good. It basically boils down to this. If you're looking for something unique, this is it. If the issues mentioned above are off-putting, then don't get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198970857856', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1655196256}
review:
EDIT: i have since 100%'d this game and i still love it dearly, but i will not be changing my review until the issues i had are addressed. restarting and playing through the whole game again because of bad rng was something *I* was willing to do, but not something i would expect of everyone playing this game, and as such my review will stay negative until the issues are fixed.

i love this game and i recommend you to play it if you're a fan of charming worlds or boss rush games, it does these very well and it's a very fun adventure game.

what i DONT recommend is for you to 100% this game. ever.
spoilers ahead so read with caution.
popocity is so terribly designed and is the killer if your first 100% run, no matter WHAT. you will HAVE to 100% this game twice because of the event involving reaching 10,000 credits. when you reach popocity it's already around 8,000, and will tick up over time so even if you do nothing it will eventually reach 10,000. why is this an issue? simple, many events can ONLY be completed BEFORE it reaches 10,000 and (unlike most events) CANNOT be completed after you beat breevis. the worst example is the kneft invasion, which is where i lost my run. 5.5 hours in and i have literally done EVERYTHING ELSE up to this point, all i had to do was a couple of missions i knew could be completed after breevis, the fried kneft happiness point, and the kneft invasion. i had totally forgotten the kneft invasion was a thing and spent so long trying to get the bad kneft from fishing (nothing but good fish hooks, by the way) that the city reached 10,000. so before i went to fight breevis i figured i would take care of the kneft invasion. but for SOME REASON the kneft invasion GOES AWAY WHEN YOU REACH 9,999. not after breevis, which is what would make sense, but RIGHT when the city locks up. so if you take too long doing the mandatory events for 100% you are PERMANENTLY LOCKED OUT OF 100%ING THE GAME AND MUST RESTART. not to mention, i was playing on INSANE MODE. so if i want to get back to where i was, i would have to replay 2/3rds of the game all over again and make sure i did ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING on a TIMER to make sure that i didn't miss anything and would have to repeat it all over again. 100%ing this game is terribly designed and ruined all good graces i had for this insanely charming and fun game. if you play this game, for the love of god do not 100% it.
developer_response:
Sorry to hear you had such a bad time 100%ing it. However, you should be able to fight the kneft infestation after you've reached the sinkhole. You just can't do it during the Popo City event you described, because all credit counters are locked. Once they're re-enabled you're good to go. 

There are some events in the game that you can skip or miss, but none of them should affect your ability to 100% the game.

review: 非常可爱的小游戏，没想到能花费我这么长时间去玩。剧情略微拖沓但可爱的小细节很多，比如画家会把你画的烟花挂在电梯口，帮助过的人会记得你 ，给你不同的选项。 游戏最大的反派也很可爱，战斗不难，但也有一点挑战性。非常适合喜欢2d休闲，喜欢软萌画风的人玩，打折三元人民币，只赚不亏，买了不玩也是可可爱爱的库存图标吖

author: {'steamid': '76561197976565082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 245, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1664479127}
review:
This is the game in my library that I'd say most closely fits the description of "hidden gem".
I am unsure about how this game even ended up in my library. It probably was included in some humble bundle. I certainly never would have thought of buying it.
One day, as I was pondering over which game to play in my ever-increasing steam backlog, I threw a few dice to let fate decide for me, and fate playfully decided to present me with Wuppo. At first I thought: "No no no! Even I have some standards, I might be playing crap every other day but I'm still not going to play that!". But somehow, I managed to go against that impulse and give it a try, and boy was I right to do so.
Funny absurd humor, unique art style, good gameplay, daunting challenges, this game has it all. It's by no mean a masterpiece, but man is it good.
This game is a very unique blend of what I'd call point-and-click-style exploration and humor with tight and challenging boss fights. The art style and the absurd humor make me feel nostalgic as they remind me of my childhood flash and RPG maker games. Like Shadow of the Colossus, the bosses are basically the only action part of the game, and here, they come as a reward, or a sort of break from the other half of the game, the world's exploration.
Anyway. In case the message didn't come through: I recommend it.

=======大小=======

author: {'steamid': '76561198078048130', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1638798510}
review:
유치원에 다니는 상상력 풍부한 조카가 정성껏 그린 스케치북안에서 모험을 하는 느낌

플레이타임은 약 8시간정도로 게임 하면서 꽤 오래 한거 같은데 플레이타임 보고 이 정도 밖에 안걸렸다고?라는 생각이 들 만큼 알찬 플레이를 할 수 있었습니다.
단순하고 귀여운 그래픽에 비해 의외로 플레이 하면서 볼 수 있는 세부적인 요소로 예를 들면 구체적인 세계관과 현실적인 시간 흐름에 따라 바뀌는 분위기, 상황에 맞는 캐릭터들의 행동과 대사, 약간의 미니게임, 적절하게 다가갈 수 있는 숨겨진 맵들에 심지어 탑승할 수 있는 어트렉션까지! 즐길 수 있는 요소가 정말 많아 지루할 틈이 없었습니다.

개인적으로 플렛포머 게임은 길 찾기, 특유의 액션, 퍼즐 때문에 어려워 하지만 이 게임은 큰 무리 없이 즐길 수 있었습니다. 중간중간 필요 할 때마다 무엇을 해야하는지 간접적으로 볼 수 있으며, 다양한 난이도 조절도 있지만 보통 난이도 기준 개인 컨트롤이 부족해도 3트 안에는 충분히 클리어 가능하기에 진행에도 무리가 없었습니다.

개인적으론 플레이 타임에 비해 정가 주고 사기에는 살짝 비싼감이 있지만 할인도 자주 하기에 할인기간에 구매하셨다가 플레이 하시는걸 권장하며, 게임할 시간이 없지만 짧고 강렬하게 어드벤쳐 게임을 엔딩까지 보고 싶으신 분들께 추천드립니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045126872', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1509292563}
review: Wuppo is a brilliant and surprisingly expansive metrodvania in which you play a mischievous little blob uncovering a lot of ancient and bizarre history on your way to trying to find a new place to live - the classic millenial experience. The game is packed with charming characters, and at every major act the game somehow shifts and grows its scale in a completely unexpected way. The gameplay is really tight, with the exception of a couple of very frustrating boss fights, but overall the experience of playing Wuppo is one of pure joy and wonder. Definitely check it out if you're looking for a funny, colorful, lovingly-made metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882361418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1564248378}
