author: {'steamid': '76561198328274047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1562989218}
review: 很棒的一款遊戲，難度適中，就算是手殘黨多試幾遍就能通關。不止是畫風劇情也很可愛，世界觀意外地詳細，半價購入不虧！一些等待也很真實，比如排隊等車、排遊樂場等等，存檔點也不少，某解謎關卡難度高於BOSS戰，建議可以先自己玩，實在過不去時再查攻略！

author: {'steamid': '76561197968095656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1559743494}
review:
Just got done playing Wuppo and thoroughly enjoyed it. Don't let the cartoon-y graphics put you off.  This game had much more depth and length than I was expecting.  The tone and world reminded me of the Paper Mario franchise; the characters, dialog, and story are some of the strongest elements of the game.  The world is full of life; lots of inhabitants moving around and animated elements. 

Fighting is a bigger part of the game than I initially expected.  The combat system is simple, but enjoyable. The boss battles are surprisingly challenging.

The most frustrating element may be managing so many items in your inventory, but the shortcut system keeps this out of the way most of the time.  I got a little stuck a couple times, but I managed to push through without a guide.  If you are not sure how to progress, a little trial and error are your friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322413521', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1559739096}
review:
前5个小时是享受，中5个小时是迷茫，后5个小时是对着攻略无情杀BOSS的机器人。
这也是第一个我乖乖排队等车的游戏，BOSS两分钟，排队半小时，一不小心跳出去了还得重排，插队插不进去，NPC又杀不死，坐蹦极车终于排到我了把币投进去没跳上去还被NPC抢了！气煞我也！

author: {'steamid': '76561197973832609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1658, 'last_played': 1559401055}
review:
Have just completed the story mode on Insane (highest difficulty) and i quite enjoyed the journey.

If you are interested in the game i would recommend it though keep in mind the game reeeeaaaalllllyyyy likes to waste time, some things are on a real world timer so you have to wait for a few things and what i consider the midgame, popocity took probably 10-12h on its own. Used fishing to gain money and it took forever, if you go for the same route i did, fish and sell all upgrades, radio and armor to afford the last upgrades and an item required for max health. 

the time is a bit inflated as i keept the game on while i was away but i would say the story took ~18/22h with some time lost due to checkpoints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204256856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1689132325}
review:
한글화 되기 전에 플레이했던 게임이고 게임을 플레이한 것도 엄청 예전이긴 한데
가끔 지하도시에서 얻을 수 있는 커피 달린 모자가 생각납니다.
지하 도시의 꽤 긴 다리 구간에서 커피 빨면서 이동하는 캐릭터 보려고 일부러 걸어갔던 기억이 있네요.
모자에 달린 커피가 엄청 달달한 레쓰비 맛일 것 같아서 자주 땡겼습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038427975', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1566816728}
review: Очаровательное приключение симпатичного кругляша на четырёх маленьких ножках в стиле мультсериала "Adventure Time". Игра полна доброго юмора и забавной анимации (отдельного упоминания заслуживает и мимика главного героя). Нарисованный мир интересно исследовать. И каждый раз с интересом смотришь новые диафильмы, которые разбросаны во всём игровом мире. Боссы на нормальной сложности не такие уж и сложные. Однозначно рекомендую к прохождению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334482952', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1617808055}
review:
最值得的几块大洋！！镜头音乐画风人物剧情难度都超棒！冰激凌全场最佳！
刚开始玩的时候是一款休闲冒险游戏，乌姆超可爱，抱着冰激凌蹦蹦哒哒，开始冒险后，面对精心设计的boss打打杀杀，为了找到炒鸡多的细节奔奔走走，逐渐体验奇异而又安稳的世界，揭开一层层的秘密。
通关普通难度之后，你发现23个成就就给了仨 (≖_≖)，然后就想打全成就，于是查攻略狂收集，发现各种没发现的小细节，变成一个休闲收集游戏，甚至....排队游戏（？？？）
作者真的是在奇奇怪怪的地方很真实。
再后来你又发现，最后剩一个boss run的成就改变了游戏类型，此时wuppo作为一款再次被冰激凌carry全场的魂系游戏，其作者真的是丧!心!病!狂!
别说了，我还能再试几次。

author: {'steamid': '76561197975101989', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1558051682}
review:
Such a charming little game. I loved the characters and the humor. It reminds me a lot of Paper Mario. It's fun to just walk around and talk to people to see what they have to say. The world is weird and interesting and I loved learning more about it the further I got in the game.  
I enjoyed the shooting gameplay as well. The bosses all felt challenging, but never unfair. There's also lots of secrets to find which is nice.  
Overall I enjoyed the game. It's cute and weird and I think it's great. I recommend it.

review:
乌姆很可爱的一点是幸福度设定，幸福度加点是直接加最大生命值的。基本就是越幸福越不容易死去。
然后什么东西可以加幸福度呢，吃某种非常好吃的冰淇淋，相信美好的预言，结交一个朋友，泡两个小时的澡，站在岛上吹泡泡之类。
其实就是这样而已。

author: {'steamid': '76561198211802309', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1655105644}
review:
first of my playtime is wrong because i played in offline mode.i finished the game and also almost completed it.
pros:
-funny dialogues
-good artstyle
-suprisingly challenging boss fights(suprising becuase ca. 90% of the enemys in the game are bosses
-i love how you just feel like "one of many" and the world does not exist only becuase of you. for example if you want to take the train you have to wait until it arrives,let the other passengers get out,let the cleaning group do their job,get in,wait until you arrive at your destination(you can play a mini-game during this part),get out and get in line for the ID card check.

if you liked the closet joke from "the messenger" you will love this game because their version of that ends in [spoiler] a secret boss fight [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198315626797', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1555695047}
review: 游戏最大的特点就是可爱，各种小动画超棒。剧情不错但是后期很迷，游戏最终的内容和前面的内容感觉基本无关（感觉游戏的世界观是由两个人分开写的）。不需要肝的游戏，如果解密起来比较快的话游戏流程就大大缩短了，但是由于游戏内的提示实在是有点少，很多时候都处于我该去哪里怎么办的探索状态。不过由于不要肝，所以对于想玩第二遍的人来说很友好，可以把精力集中在全收集上面了。有兴趣的可以打折入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561198949143732', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1555057318}

还有，为什么不可以插队啊！！！！！我要去哪玩，游乐园的NPC总是抢在我前面去……好气哦

author: {'steamid': '76561197995361890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1554498498}
review:
[h1] The Metroidvania Review[/h1]
 [url= https://metroidvaniareview.com/2019/04/15/wuppo/] Scored Summary[/url] |  |                          [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30503887/] Subscribe to our Curator	[/url]

 [b]How Metroidvania is it?[/b]
Low Fit –  [i]Wuppo[/i] is a lot less about exploration and more about adventure game style puzzle solving. It’s sort of like if [i]Monkey Island[/i] ate a twin stick shooter platformer. 
 
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/MetroidvaniaReview/discussions/1/1744480967004628507/] Want to hear a different opinion, or want to share your own review? Check out our Forum here.[/url]

[h1]Full Review[/h1]
[i]Wuppo[/i] is a strange mix of [i]Paper Mario[/i],  a twin stick shooter platformer, and an adventure game. Something about this mix made people think “Metroidvania” but overall to me it feels like [i]Monkey Island 3[/i] for structural reasons I’ll talk about a little later on. I think if you’re looking for a Metroidvania style experience, [i]Wuppo[/i] has flavors of it, but the primary focus is on quirky characters and adventure game style puzzles, and for what it is it’s a ton of fun. 

The entire premise of the game is that your fat Wum is a slob and gets kicked out of his halfway house thus kicking off his (her?) hijinx filled adventure where he haphazardly saves the universe. All of your interaction with NPCs is done with the kind of flair that you would see in a Nintendo game. Every character has a personality quirk that makes them humorous because they’re larger than life, but they’re also grounded in a reality that makes them feel almost real. Your character is a “Wum”, a species of armless Kirby creatures with tiny bug legs, and he reacts to conversation with amusing facial expressions, giving interactions a delightful energy. The game sort of forces you to learn about the different species in the world – there are at least eight that you interact with – but in spite of it being something of an exposition dump it does it in such an entertaining way that I didn’t mind it.

In fact, that world building is something that [i]Wuppo[/i] strangely does very well. In spite of being a surreal mishmash of both cringe and curiosity, it’s all constructed in a way that made me almost believe it was real place. From an escapist standpoint, [i]Wuppo[/i] is a world that welcomes you in and quietly entices you away from whatever worldly cares you have in real life. The overarching story is a product of weirdness, but perhaps as you play you’ll start to care about the individual characters in the game – or at least – you’ll care about preserving its world as much as possible. A lot of the game’s content is completely optional – only opening up more and new interesting things about its history and characters rather than providing any tangible in-game benefit. But interacting with all of those elements is rewarding in itself, firmly establishing that this is a game less about gameplay and more about its world.

In that vein, puzzle solutions are less rigid than many adventure games. In two of the four major sections of the game, your primary goal isn’t to just get from point A to point B, but rather you’re given an objective that has multiple solutions for accomplishing. This lack of rigidity sets it apart from other adventure games – so while you have several items to brush against things, in many cases they don’t act as “keys” gating your progress as much as they [i]feel[/i] like logical solutions the problem. Not that there aren’t [i]any[/i] key-like puzzle solutions, but the method of getting the key is often open and up to the player on how they want to obtain it. This is all ingenious game design helps to keep the game to that high level of immersion, but it also opens the game up to players that don’t necessarily like the 90s style of adventure game. 

Of course, the more casual 90s adventure gamers would also potentially have some difficulty with [i]Wuppo’s[/i] combat. I played the game on hard mode, but even on the normal difficulty I can only imagine some of the game’s bosses giving less action game oriented players some trouble. There aren’t a ton of “regular” enemies throughout the game world – the ones that are there go down pretty easily save a few annoying fish monsters. The real challenge comes from the 17 bosses. Wuppo is a twin-stick shooter, meaning you’ll be jumping and shooting using your shoulder buttons and controlling your movement and aiming with the analog sticks – if you’re playing with a controller. In twin-stick fashion this means most bosses are a balance of bullet-hell-esque barrages and while continually applying damage to weakpoints as you move. From the boss pattern to your Wum’s controls, everything feels just a little loose, meaning it took me a few tries to get used to new boss patterns before everything clicked. This isn’t necessarily bad, especially since every boss has a checkpoint just prior to facing them, but it’s perhaps not exactly the industry’s best when it comes to combat. But like everything in [i]Wuppo[/i], encounters are more than just a mechanical challenge, there is also a high level of entertainment coming from who and what you’re fighting at any given time. Overall I’d rate the combat as above average. 

As far as [i]Wuppo’s[/i]  “Metroidvania-ness” goes I mentioned previously that it reminds me more of [i]Monkey Island 3[/i] than it does [i]Super Metroid[/i] or [i]Castlevania[/i]. While you can technically go back to any old area as new areas are opened up, you’re given little incentive to do so. Each area plays like a chapter, and once you accomplish the primary goal you move on. There isn’t ever any feeling that you’re exploring to find power-ups to progress, but rather you’re exploring to find information. Because of that I think there might be some crossover in interest for fans of [i]La-Mulana[/i], just with less Metroidvania factor and the combat isn’t quite as difficult. Because of the previously mentioned fluidity of the puzzle design, you’re also not solving riddles in the same way as [i]La-Mulana[/i] – most of the time. There are a few that do require you to know about the game’s world to progress, but they aren’t nearly as prevalent, and if you’re paying attention to the game’s NPC interactions they’re not particularly difficult. 

The primary draw of [i]Wuppo[/i] is its quirky characters, its entertaining method of storytelling, and the overall immersion that its world provides. It has just enough challenge to it to make it more than just an escapist fantasy, but escapism is definitely its main strength. If you’re looking for a break from every day life, and just want a fun and inviting video game world to stay in for a while, [i]Wuppo[/i] is practically unparalled within the confines of its limitations as an indie title. 

4 out of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198044991542', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1555189316}
review:
Wuppo is an adventure platformer with a bit of a metroidvania vibe, although it is mostly linear. The overarching plot is pretty basic and the last act kind of comes out of nowhere, but this is made up for by the worldbuilding - the world of Wuppo is interesting and there is quite a lot one can learn about it. The mood of the game is really laid back with a good dose of humor.

Only a few minor flaws stood out to me during my playthrough - the aforementioned last act, relatively clunky inventory considering how much item juggling you'll have to do and the fact that an ingame train is on a relatively long realtime schedule (fortunately, you technically only need to use it once).

Overall, I have really enjoyed my time with Wuppo and it is an easy recommendation if you're looking for a relaxed gaming experience. If you end up liking it and find yourself wanting more, I would also like to recommend an oldschool freeware classic called "An Untitled Story" - there are many similarities between them and I would not at all be surprised to learn that it served as an inspiration for Wuppo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055980036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1591022542}
review:
This game is an amazing experience, felt like a kid again flouring with imagination. The care of making its simple/fun game mechanic, the world building and its lore, and its quirky and memorable music is such a sensation. Insane difficulty is pretty wack, yet satisfying after a tough grind.

[i] I am a changed wum. [/i]

Happy to see Lars nurtured this gem during a long time of development, and replaying it is always welcoming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085709146', 'num_games_owned': 3029, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1554997502}
review:
Wuppo is a puzzle-platformer in which you explore a whimsical and lively world inhabited by four multi-legged, friendly, round-ish shaped races - Wums, Blussers, Splenhakkers and Fnakkers. What starts as a quest to go back home, turns into a engaging story about friendship, politics and meaning of life (with a dash of saving the world thrown in). 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

I feel like the time spent in the game is split between three main elements pretty evenly. Those would be fighting with your trusty Gumgumgun, jumping around and solving puzzles and talking to other creatures.

The boss fights were well-made, I played on normal difficulty and they were challenging enough to make me sweat a little, but not too hard to make me feel frustrated. Each fight was also pretty different from another, regarding the boss mechanics. I'd often die on the first attempt, just to understand the boss' move pattern and breeze through it the next try.

If I had to point out one thing that was constantly bugging me while playing, it would definitely be the inventory management. As you progress through the game, you get more and more items and even through you can set up hotkeys, if you're playing with a controller, there's just not enough buttons to have all the useful items easily accessible, which means you'll be browsing your inventory pretty often. This wouldn't be that much of an issue, however, Wuppo doesn't feature active pause. So, if you're in a boss battle and don't have any healing items bound to a hotkey, you will most likely die. It's not that bad on the normal difficulty, as I didn't find myself using healing items too often anyway, but I feel it might be a huge annoyance when playing on the harder modes.

[h1] Graphics [/h1]

The game was made by only two people and it shows. I mean, don't get me wrong, I actually think it looks pretty great, as the rather crude but childish style actually fits the whole game perfectly. However, you might notice that some elements, e.g. the purple tubes in Popo City can be a bit of an eye-sore. Despite that, I do love how the game looks. 

It's often a case with Indie games that even though they look good-ish on the first look, the more you play, the more boring the scenery becomes, you just notice the copy pasting of assets and plain, empty textures covering most of the screen. This is definitely NOT a case with Wuppo. I feel like the devs have spent A LOT of time creating the world, there's a lot of work put into every level. Be it some weird plants in the background, mysterious runes carved into rocks or even some moss in long abandoned ruins. Every part of the world is refreshing in it's own way and I loved exploring them.

One more thing that deserves praise, especially for an indie game like that is the liveliness of the portrayed world. The locations feel really alive. The city is full of Wums rushing somewhere in hurry or just working on something. Creatures are queueing to the Wondersplenk attractions or interacting with each other. Many AAA open-world games could learn a thing or two from Wuppo when it comes to adding a 'beating heart' to the world.

[h1] Sound & Music [/h1]

The music in Wuppo is perfectly made. I felt like every piece was actually carefully chosen for the level I was in. Wumhouse music was really warm and sort of melancholic. The dark passages and ruins had more mysterious and weird soundtracks. The city's music was work-inspiring and fitting the general rush everyone was in perfectly. It's often a bit goofy sounding, which also fits the general theme of the game. The combination of the graphics, sound design and story really reminded me of the time long ago when I played The Neverhood. It just sparked the same warm and melancholic feelings in me and I think it's great that games can still do that.

[h1] Plot and Character Design [/h1]

The story of Wuppo starts rather silly, but develops nicely. It's nothing too original, it's easy to predict how most of the events will unfold. But it's still solid and with a dash of humour added, I was happy to play through it and even watched most of the filmstripes just for the fun of it.

The dialogues can be really brilliantly written. I think I talked to all of the NPCs and always went through all possible options. There's a lot of information hidden there, as well as, jokes or some general life wisdom.

The life wisdom, which actually deserves a paragraph of its own. I think the story is merely a pretext to talk and think about real life and it's problems. It may not be obvious immediately, but the game touches upon a lot of real life topics. For example, the four main races present different approaches to life, or types of people. Wums are more outgoing, Blussers are the introverts, Splenhakkers like building and constructing and Fnakkers seem to be centered mostly on the physical development. But even within one race, like Wums, there are differences. Wums in the Wumhouse like their lazy, relaxed life, while the Wums in Popo city are focused only on work. There's also the focus on making friends, which yet again reminded me of The Neverhood. And let's not forget about the stereotypes and how they're often misleading and disrupt our communication attempts.

All in all, I think there're a lot of topics regarding real life and its meaning embedded into Wuppo. It's not too much 'in your face' though, it doesn't really push any agendas on the player. It mostly just presents how different people have different priorities in their lives and how we should respect that.

[h1] Overall [/h1]

To sum up, I thoroughly enjoyed playing Wuppo. If you feel like setting out on a mystical, but a tad goofy journey through life with boss fights and some puzzles, this is a game for you. Relax and just hop into this slightly crazy world, but remember; NO ICE CREAM IN THE LOBBY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066960569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1703705744}
review:
What makes Wuppo so special to me is that it has one of the most delightful, fully realized worlds I've ever encountered in a game, and it's so believable and immersive that it doesn't even feel like a game most of the time.

The level design is natural and doesn't feel like it specifically caters to the player's goals, like everything you come across could easily exist without you.  Time moves on its own, as do the hundreds of background characters who are all doing their own thing, living their own lives.  And the Wum you play as isn't some prophesied hero and doesn't even have any particularly noteworthy abilities by the end of the game; you're just one small citizen like anyone else in this big ol' world, which keeps the whole experience down-to-earth.

The heartbeat of this game also comes through in the way it progresses.  There aren't many moments that clearly define progress in the story, because just as much care and attention was put in the optional content as the main adventure, so it rarely feels like you're following a script.  The game still gives you suitable hints for making progress, but I didn't focus on them too much, because exploration is perhaps Wuppo's greatest focus.  Wandering around is often rewarding, if for no other reason than being able to witness more of the game's charming personality.

If I were to break down my minor gripes with Wuppo, one would be the combat.  The controls are very simple and generally effective, but dodging enemies and their attacks isn't always reasonable, so there were times when I wished for some sort of dash move.  Some of the enemy fire is also difficult to see, either because it's small or somewhat dark.  The inventory system is mildly cumbersome, and even though the button shortcuts help, they still leave something to be desired.  There were also a couple points in the story where I wasn't sure how to progress, although the game does remarkably well at keeping the flow most of the time, thanks to a number of its presented problems having multiple solutions.

Wuppo was clearly made with a vision.  It's a gem, and I recommend it to anyone who likes to explore and wants to smile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097420078', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1554878012}

author: {'steamid': '76561198148620362', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1554738067}
review:
《Wuppo》是一款各方面素质都很高的RPG作品。

千万别认为这款游戏，画面像是用Windows画图软件怼出来的，就觉得这游戏会很简陋。事实上，这款游戏的画面风格正好符合游戏的整体氛围：轻松，简单，可爱。其实只要稍微注意一些，你就会发现，该在画面中表达出来的东西都表达出来了，细节也不少。

平台方面：倒没有很新鲜的机制，不过BOSS战斗的设计还行，BOSS形象很有创意（事实上游戏里几乎所有形象都很有创意），据说高难度下BOSS难度有显著提升，本人没有也不是很想尝试。

RPG方面：剧情设定在一个新奇的世界观之中，而剧情主线......我就不剧透了，大多数剧情可以用”出人意料“来形容。而游戏的世界设计让玩家真正觉得，主角在世界中不是孤单的，尤其是在诸如游乐园、大城市这样的场景，乘坐一些公共交通工具需要等待，排队想要插队还会被挤下来，太真实了。虽然世界观设计天马行空，但设定自洽，现在的新世界观游戏中很少有做到这一点的。

而最为人称道的一个方面，应该就是这款游戏在细节方面下的功夫了。这些细节给这款RPG中的角色赋予了鲜明的性格，也让角色设计更加可信。比如同样的录影带给不同的放映师看，由于放映师的立场不同，给出的旁白也就不一样。[spoiler]又比如洗澡的胖子说见到一个也来洗澡，但会觉得尴尬不希望身份透漏出去的老哥，而在前台的日记中，发现前台就是那个老哥。[/spoiler]把一些特定的物品拿给特定的角色看，也会有特殊的对话。这些细节虽然不是所有玩家都能看到，但能让看到了的玩家感受到开发组的用心，从而带来极高的兴趣和乐趣，这同时也是《Undertale》和《Deltarune》的优秀之处（为了不被说ky，点到即止）。

OST非常用心，游戏过程中没有感觉到BGM有重复。而且OST质量很高，有很多曲子都有洗脑的调调，推荐入手。

总而言之，这是一款素质非常优秀的作品，喜欢RPG的玩家一定不能错过。

author: {'steamid': '76561198140589637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 2781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2781, 'last_played': 1554757439}
review:
[Rating: 7/10]
[Better alternative: Ori and the Blind Forest]
A cutesy platformer that presents limited challenges and a somewhat confusing story.

[Pros]
+ High quality production.
+ Interesting art-style
[Cons]
- Nonsensical story line and puzzles.
- Too difficult to bypass accidentally-triggered dialogue.
- Poor inventory management and useless mini-map.
- Indistinct scenery sometimes obscures the path forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088668490', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1555015363}
review:
Wuppo is insanely good. I would rank it as one of my favorite games of all time. The game is very finely crafted and super charming, everything works flawlessly and has a quality similar to high end Nintendo games. Wuppo also feels like a living breathing world, from the little flower people you meet in the early game, to the big bustling Popo city, all the creatures feel lively and like they have a place in the world. Usually I don't like platformers very much, but for Wuppo it feels great. In terms of content, you can beat the game in around 10-11 hours if you rush through without doing any side quests or attempting a completionist route. If you do end up taking that route you could probably spend about 20-30 or so hours on the game.

If you have been thinking of purchasing Wuppo, please do, this game is way too good to turn down. This game get a solid 10 out of 10 for me and I am extremely excited to see what the devs will create in the future.

火車也是真正的依照遊戲內的時間運作
太早去車站也沒人排隊. 然後火車快來的時候旅客漸漸變多
小細節設定得很可愛啊.

和NPC對話也很有趣. 有很多白爛的選項哈哈哈

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198131281607', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1554541620}
review:

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]总体评价🏆[/th]
        [th]B[/th]
        [th]高于平均[/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]

麻雀虽小，五脏俱全。

画质，剧情，游戏系统，每一样乍看都是狂放不羁，大笔乱涂。

细玩下来却像个心思细腻的壮汉，但又没有细腻到矫情的程度。

比起多数同一量级同类型游戏而言，细节可以算出色，具体体现在文案、辅助玩法、npc/场景交互上。

对于经历过 Hollow Knight 这类游戏洗练的玩家而言，这款游戏的最高难度也不会很让人抓狂，它不会用恶劣的陷阱来拖慢玩家的步伐，而是用一些解密要素取而代之，玩家大多数的时间可以花在挑战boss和探索世界上。[strike]也可能是花在排队等车、搬砖促进GDP、钓鱼养老或逛游乐园上。[/strike]

总之，多种难度适应各类人群，强制剧情少，收集要素适量，简约而不智障，值得一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198062806921', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1624978006}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015297191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1529836326}
review:
전체적인 디자인부터 캐릭터의 성격들 까지 하나하나 다 귀여운 게임.
나름의 세계관과 스토리가 게임에 대한 몰입을 도와주지만 엔딩은 좀 아쉬웠음.
거의 마지막의 던전의 퍼즐은 정말 골치아파서 공략을 보고 깼지만 그 외의 퍼즐들은 쉬워서 좋았음.
플탐도 10시간 정도로 가격대비 충분하고 게임도 가벼운 오픈 월드(라기에는 작은) 느낌이라 재밌었음.

review: 五星好评！画风很可爱，谜题很有趣，世界很庞大。游戏里的人物也像主角一样可爱善良。boss战做得很精彩，虽然是个可爱风的游戏，但是boss还是要有一定技术才能打过的。最后的结局有种意犹未尽的感觉，希望小乌姆的冒险之旅用不完结。

review: I had gotten this game a while ago, hadn't played it but my girlfriend saw it while I was scrolling through my library and thought that characters were cute, so I said she should play it! Overall, highly recommend for casual and hardcore gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198438912204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4682, 'last_played': 1559477545}
review:
이 게임은 초딩인 제가 스팀에서 가장 처음으로 산 게임입니다. 그때 당시 너무나도 기뻣죠. 아기자기한 그래픽은 제 마음을 사로잡기 충분했습니다. 엄마 몰래 조금조금 하다보니 벌써 150시간이 넘었네여........ 난이도도 적당한 편이고, 모른다면 노력하지 말고 공략을 보시는 것을 추천합니다. 훌륭한 게임성을 가지고있고, 탄탄한 스토리, 재밌는 이스터에그를 포함한 제가 할 수 있는 모든 칭찬을 써도 힘들 정도입니다. 다만, 한 가지 아쉬운 것은 컨텐츠가 확실히 부실하다는 것입니다. 스토리를 깨고 나면 다음 난이도를 도전하거나, 보스런을 할 수 있습니다. 네, 그게 이 게임의 다 입니다. 이 부분만 고치면 정말 완벽할 것 같네여......... 강추!

요약: 아기자기한 그래픽, 좋은 게임성, 부실한 컨텐츠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023716252', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1590406176}
review: Прекрасная игра! Особенно приятна для изучения английского, простые и интересные диалоги!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031200115', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1581296157}
review:
Honestly wasn't expecting too much from this game at all. I didn't even remember it was in my library the first time I booted it up. I can definitely say, without a doubt, this game surprised me. 

This game has so much personality and charm oozing out of every corner of it that I cannot recommend it enough if you enjoy explorative platforming and games with tons of character (like the Paper Mario games for example). The game isn't particularly deep or anything, but it doesn't feel like it's trying to be. It's a fun, immersive experience all the way through that I thoroughly enjoyed.

I think I'll be running through the game again in the future.

review: A unique adventure game with fun characters in a imaginative world. Not a metroidvania though, as the progression is pretty linear. The main focus are boss battles, puzzles, and exploring. But the charm is in the story, humor, lore, and the aesthetic feel of the world these characters live in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968187165', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1551616627}
review:
見た目はめちゃくちゃ面白そうなんだけどがんばれば文字無しで行けそうなのに
少し読んだ感じだと対して面白くもなさそうな感じの文章が大量にあってそれで内容のかなりの部分を説明してる感じ
多分クエとか文章読まないとまったくわからんとか余裕ででてくると思う
普段ゲームしない人が買うと周りに勧めちゃいそうな感じ
見た感じは任天堂が作りそうな感じで面はあるけど動かしてて楽しい感じではない動きがプレーンで
ただジャンプができて弾がだせるだけでゲーム性3/100欲しくても動画でみるだけでお腹いっぱいになれると思う
バンドルでついてきたが１００円でかったとして１５点

author: {'steamid': '76561198271252168', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2036, 'last_played': 1551451589}
review:
[h1]Wuppo超棒！[/h1]
这个游戏实在是太可爱了，很早之前就买了一直放置play，没想到会如此对我口味。
[b]游戏方式涉及平台跳跃、弹幕射击和解谜探索等要素，特别适合喜欢此类的玩家游玩，不过最最重要的是游戏内拥有完整的世界观、严肃的生活细节、性格鲜明的NPC、有趣的互动、丰富的支线任务和收集要素，还拥有许多待挖掘的彩蛋。总之两个字:好玩! [/b] 
喜欢休闲探索的玩家更加不要错过。




所有生物都好可爱hhh
p.s不看攻略探索食用效果更好。[spoiler] 虽然有些真的很难发现[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198140419834', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1672236938}
review:
I'd seen Wuppo pop up in my recommended list a few times before playing this game, but I never really paid it any mind. It always looked really childish. One day I was browsing steam for new games to get, and I figured I might as well check this out again. It actually looked pretty good, so I decided to buy it. Most of the reviews were something along the lines of:
[b] Extremely witty, but never kiddy. [/b]
"Yeah right", I thought. As if THIS isn't kiddy.

It really isn't.
Wuppo is EXACTLY what an open world side scroller should be. I can't exactly capture the essence of this game in a review, but let me say this.
[h1] BUY THIS GAME!! [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198162520397', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1561091921}
review: emmm... 买这个游戏纯粹是被杉果的大礼包给中的, 刚开始还以为是个喜加一的垃圾游戏 , 打开感觉很幼稚 冰淇淋撒一地???  好吧,当我无聊的时候再次打开游戏决定一探究竟是,发现流程竟然诙谐有趣,每个NPC都很有趣味 ... 解密也是简单但是不失风趣 .  整体来说还是不错的游戏呢!  推荐购买!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271600214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1551199232}
review:
길치 + 똥손의 플레이 후기. (난이도 쉬움)

첫 플레이에 13시간 걸렸다. 그중 10시간은 길을 헤맨것같다.
정말 난 인내심이 대단한 사람같다. 엔딩을 봤을 때, 나는 나에게 박수를 쳐줬다.
그외에 보스나 다른 난이도는 어렵지 않았다. 어둠의 방 보스는 좀 힘들었다.
귀여운 그림을 봐서 너무너무 좋았다. 한글패치 짱이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410404376', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1550839471}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998220526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1550267143}
review: I wanted to like this game because I am really REALLY into platformers. However, I cannot recommend this one. I'm glad other people were able to enjoy this game because it isn't necessarily bad. But I found the control scheme and level design to be almost maddening. In other platformers I can coast through with relative ease. Even games that I would consider to be more difficult like Hollow Knight I normally have no issue with. This one just seems really sloppily made in this sense. I found myself spending a good deal of time fiddling with the controls and menus and fumbling through the massive open level. The level design is pretty bad. You don't really have any clear sense of direction and aren't given much in the way of instruction. Its cute, the music was pretty good from what I heard, and it obviously has some kind of story, but the shoddy mechanics and design make this pretty unplayable to me. I may try this one again in the future and possibly change my review if it sways me. I spent about an hour trying to get into it and I just couldn't.

review: This game is a masterpiece. Ok not really but its the closest game to a masterpiece i have ever played. This game has made me  so happy every second of playing it. The charm truly is there almost they entire game. now i can talk endlessly about how good this game is but sense this is a review I have only one problem with game. Now there would have been more if i was writing this when the game first came out The biggest problem it had was you being able to fall asleep in a coffeehat.  I'm just kidding although that has been fixed, the real biggest problem this game used to have was how long it would take to get all of the credit in Popo city but now the process is faster based on your progress and far less tedious. I've been thinkig and the only problem i can actually think of is Redev Kneds guest house (sorry if i spelled that wrong) the problem with this location is i suck puzzles Im just kidding but this is my oppinion and i feel that this location just doesn't have the wuppo charm i was talking about But thats litteraly it. This game has quickly become my favorite game of all time leaving This game with a 9.5/10 score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020935870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1548058045}
review:
There are already some great Wuppo reviews here, so I’d like to just share my personal perspective. 

I had so much fun. When I was playing with my gf, we were almost constantly chuckling or sincerely laughing, to the point when I had to pause the game. The dialogues are so light-hearted and fun, but at the same time I can’t help but think that some actual talent and passion was put into writing all of the jokes or just build the comical atmosphere. Almost all of the humor comes from the situations, characters and the setting itself. I can’t remember if there are any references or parodies attached to this game - it doesn’t try to mock superheros or general popular culture. Nothing about this humor is cheap. And I LOVE it.

The colorful setting, optional side content (collectibles, achievements, hidden bosses, exploration), smooth platforming, very easy to follow structure... If you are into movies or TV shows, you probably know about all these animated productions that are generally made for kids, but are so smart, that even if a child can understand them, an adult won’t be bored as well. This is how this game works. It was a great thing, to be able to just start the game after a difficult day and return to it one day later for another hour or so. It was relaxing, it was cute, it was filled with positive vibes. So happy to give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057467068', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1548146808}
review:
What an amazing experience! My wife and I love Wuppo!


The world built was truly unique and unforgettable. Its theme is by far the strongest draw card this game has to offer over other competing adventure games.

The little expressions the characters portrayed were simply perfect and up there with the great Sanrio characters like Gudetama.

I found the story surprisingly unpredictable because it didn't rely on the standard good/evil tropes.

The art style underpinned the whole experience and tells the player more about the world than the dialogue. An obliviously childlike yet functional utopia where you can believe that the worst part of your day will be spilling ice cream on the floor.... again. What a wholesome escape from reality.

Don't play this game for a challenging platformer or for the boss fights, this is all about exploring and getting absorbed in the world. My wife is new to gaming and this was a solid hit, the cute theme kept her interested and gave all the motivation needed to persevere with building up her platforming skills from scratch.

I really hope the devs got some solid recognition for this gem, it was such a refreshing change from the usual unimaginative cookie cutter games out there. Flaws (like jumping up to transition between screens) can be overlooked when a game is as lovable as this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063235518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1546327506}
review:
If you love the Paper Mario games, give this game a shot. It starts off slow, but really charms you and surprises you over the playthrough (I finished this game on a different account).

Pros:
- Great characters
- Fun boss fights, challenging
- Very fun combat
- Great theme
- Well thought-out lore
- Music

Cons:
- Color palette can make it hard to find your character (in addition to their likeness to the NPCs)
- the flow of the game takes getting used to, the first world doesn't set the tone for the rest of the levels very well

Overall great experience. Looking forward to future projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001961650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1547922870}
review: This game is a triumph. Amazing worldbuilding, exploration, depth in gameplay, nonlinear problem solving... This game is an excellent adventure game with many places to explore, filled with actual stories and life rather than a vast, empty expanse. The gameplay of a well-made metroidvania platformer as the body for a soul made of compelling, well-crafted story, charming characters, and adorable aesthetic from graphics and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018180746', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1579509552}
review:
Wuppo was a game I followed for quite some time and I decided to finally pick it up during the Winter sale. The game overall is a very charming hidden gem on steam for anybody who enjoyed the old Paper Mario titles or any platformer with story elements added. The very colorful world is filled with equally colorful characters which create a setting that provides a fun and enjoyable experience while trying to help your wum find a new home. 

Bosses, while challenging, are also still a fun experience overall and they all have unique and creative designs.

Cons:

The only major con is that the game is rather short, but I still recommend it.

review: 这游戏真是神了。玩完agony、无光之海等等一大堆压抑得要死的游戏后再玩这个。。。。竟然有点感动得想哭。画风简单，游戏却不简单。很温暖的一个游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198037753779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1546226156}
review: Cute, quirky, and challenging. The art style gets tiring after awhile but not a severe issue. It reminds me of Paper Mario 64 or Paper Mario Thousand Year door, minus it being turn based versus Wuppo being real-time. In terms of dialouge text bubbles, they too remind me of PM because they can be funny, silly and really express characters without having to hear a voice behind it. Solid little sidescroller, worth a try. More content than I was expecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828562538', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2320, 'last_played': 1693287032}
review:
wuppo 是一款你越玩越能发掘出其世界观之大的游戏，在因为把冰淇淋弄得到处都是被赶出乌姆之家后，我们在原始森林里认识了说话不太流畅都花狮人；逛了游乐场被狠狠宰钱（以及排队！）；去到了波波城这样的大城市打工、消费、为社会贡献信用分以帮忙扩建城市；踏进全然不知的一个种族的领地；穿越维度来到构成生命的粒子得以创造的领域......

而且游戏里有各式各样的乌姆，以点带面地举个例子，波波城的地下武器商会要求你吃一份责任书，上面写了它对任何顾客可能产生的破坏不负任何责任，并且不接受打折券，因为在波波城开正规店要走好久的流程，要先成为40年的公民，还要收95%的税blabla，哈哈哈超级有趣的。

再说说游戏玩法，很多游戏美术剧情都不错，但就是不好玩，而wuppo的游戏性则是拉满了，游戏没有等级设定，增加hp上限的办法是提高幸福度，听其他乌姆讲故事，吃到好吃的蛋糕、泡澡等等都可以增加幸福度，所以幸福度的增加往往是不经意的，就会非常惊喜，也会很有动力跟各种有故事的乌姆聊天。而boss战的设计也非常有趣，我最喜欢后面的一个boss，它是位厨师，会把你直接扔进大锅里，由于柴火在烧你会持续掉血，就需要接住它扔进来的蔬菜回血，可以在锅里就打败它，也可以等水位慢慢上涨跳出来贴面打。这样重机制而不是重数值的boss游玩时相当令人快乐，当然啦，战斗部分手感的打磨也是上乘的👍

另外差评里提到的语言问题很早就修复啦，小地图也有加入，不知道该干什么可以按暂停看任务目标和小地图上的问号，所以还等什么，快买呀！买了你就会不断重温玩第二遍、第三遍...然后问为什么再也找不到类似 wuppo 这样的游戏了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198852032591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1549539021}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025766671', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1576781795}
review:
Boy, where to start with this one? Really impressive world-building with lots of lively characters and locations, mixed bag of gameplay and a lot of fresh ideas. They take immersion very seriously, e.g. you have to wait in line for rollercoaster rides, trams and trains go on fixed schedules you have to wait for, there is a day and night cycle... This makes the world feel very alive and lived in, but sometimes borders on the tedious. The pacing is mostly slow, so be warned, except for the times when there is suddenly a bossfight. I didn't have too much problems with them, but I can see them being frustrating if you happen to not have to right items with you.
It's certainly not perfect, since there are a lot of rough edges here and there. I certainly got stuck a few times, because I wasn't sure what I should do next. Navigating the inventory is pretty tedious. But still, I really enjoyed the game. Exploring the world is the game's main focus, and after playing through it I still feel like there are some secrets and things still left to be uncovered.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994393513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1546209360}
review:
Well worth the cost, I think I actually got this in a pack of other games, but looks like it is under $5 right now. I really enjoyed the game overall and my wife was actually getting pretty upset with me because I could barely put it down until I beat it. Really everything was good besides a few of the negatives pointed out below.

Journal/quest tracking was lacking. I don't know if it was just my install, but anytime I looked at it there was no information besides (main quest) or some text like that. Some of the objectives/goals didn't give enough information so it ended up being trial and error to figure things out which was more tedious than fun. Things like go and find this person, oh but we forgot to mention that requires this thing.

I felt strapped for cash more than a couple times which made me not want to spend any currency for weapon upgrades or other cool things in the shops that I would have liked to buy. I ended up farming currency a few times, thankfully the ways I found were fairly fun, but still not something I ever like to do.

Some of the wait times were kind of crazy. Like the train seriously takes like 5 minutes to make a round trip.

Weapon upgrades were pretty boring. I actually used the starting weapon the entire time with only 1 upgrade.

More posting the negatives as feedback for the game makers to consider. Definitely a game worth buying!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106177373', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1803, 'last_played': 1569146553}
review: 我无法形容这款游戏有多么优秀，里面的内容太多了，你可以在里面种田经商找工作交朋友甚至是待在河边钓上一整天的鱼，你也可以去冒险拯救世界，有很多彩蛋和隐藏的剧情。强迫症福音，无比减压且剧情优秀感人，内容极其丰富的一款游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198147902525', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1558849019}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：8分（1-10）[/h1]
萌萌团子的归家之旅——《巫姆》，一款含有解密&射击元素的平台游戏。去探索这个可爱的世界，解开谜题，打败敌人，找到一个新的家园吧。
二段跳、胶胶枪，在仿若儿时用蜡笔画出的童话世界中跳跃射击，操作和画面都如此简单，却能够让人沉浸。这是一个精致的游戏，一个治愈的世界。因为吃冰激凌多次弄脏地板而被赶出家园的巫姆，无家可归的它只能去寻找一个新的家园——简单的设定，却讲述了一个不平凡的故事。游戏地图很大，其中隐藏着各种彩蛋；听着轻灵愉快的背景音乐，在偌大世界中，或结识朋友，或打败敌人，或找寻隐蔽的商人进行交易。
在这可爱的画面之中，无论是探索世界、解谜冒险都不会感到枯燥。不过游戏地图较大且各场景互相连通，但是却没有小地图，有时不经意的一跳直接跳回原点，真是不知该哭还是该笑呢。游戏中可触发事件和互动内容相比于地图大小不算多，但是所有对话和幻灯片都要留意，否则可能会因为思路断掉从而影响解谜，导致卡关。
[h1]欢迎大家关注我们的鉴赏家：http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28763059[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198248541424', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1558758827}
review:
这是一款十分精致的小游戏，我从来没有想到过一款小游戏能够做到那么精致的地步，尤其是细节十分到位，比如你排队，是不能插队的，而当你带上囚犯帽子的时候，所有NPC都会对你有所畏惧，每个NPC的性格特点刻画的很鲜明，故事有始有终

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267147', 'num_games_owned': 7582, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1545898237}
review:
What a great game! [I]Wuppo[/I] is a long, complex, and challenging platformer adventure. Though it's crammed with characters and lore (and many dialogs), it contains delightfully diverse gameplay throughout. Most of it is about finding or buying items and using them to solve puzzles, but there is also some good combat (many "boss" fights), platform jumping, and mundane activities such as fishing and ... waiting in line for a roller coaster.

All of this takes place in a deliberately silly and funny world that nevertheless makes sense. It's immersive enough to provide the backdrop for a coherent and engaging story, as good as you would find in game worlds that take themselves much, much more seriously. It seems that the creators worked hard to avoid any associations with our own world and its history, but if you squint just enough you'll see some subtle parody and commentary. Blink and it's gone, replaced with a pleasant and bubbly society in which life is carefree and strife is rather toothless.

I strongly recommend [I]Wuppo[/I], but it's still worth pointing out some faults to keep your expectations in check.

The music and sound design are consistently good. The visual style is ... consistent. It's charming, to be sure, but the choice to use a very low resolution and meager color palette are a sure sign of trying too hard to be "retro." There are less grating ways to be minimalistic. At times, this style can be frustrating, as when it's almost impossible to see where you are in a screen crowded with fast-moving low-res blobs. Could we at least have made the protagonist a unique color? I also was distracted by by the "helpful" bubble following you around to tell you how many hit points you have left. This should have been pushed to a corner of the screen.

The diverse gameplay does sometimes stumble. Pacing, for example, is uneven. The game starts with a lot of action platforming, but then slows down to spaced-out puzzle solving. It almost feels like you're in a different game. These styles should have been more intertwined.

Simple activities are sometimes made hard by obfuscating them via a lack of cues on how you're supposed to use items. Oh, I'm supposed to press a button, hold it pressed, and [I]then[/I] move? How about an in-game tutorial to explain these things? I only found out midway through the game that I can create shortcut buttons to access inventory items. This, too, should have been explained.

Finally, though [I]Wuppo[/I] is at heart a platformer, the controls are far too loose. It's too easy to slip and slide instead of neatly landing at your intended destination after jumping. Usually it's just annoying to have to go back and jump again, but during a boss fight it could be frustrating. Luckily, there are few enough boss fights and platforming areas to make this not too big of an issue. But if the balance were any different...

All in all, [I]Wuppo[/I] as a whole works so well that it's impossible to dwell on any of its faults. Grab your controller (or keyboard), set aside a few evenings, and let yourself be transported into its wacky world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367252204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1643193931}
review:
第一句话：Wuppo是我最喜欢的游戏，没有之一。
Gumgumgun!!!!!!!!!!
Wuppo也是我入坑steam的契机，却把评测拖了两年，真是不好意思。
这是一款极为可爱有趣的游戏。操作简单，画风很萌，音乐也十分活泼，世界观更能令人耳目一新。2017年2月18日，我通关了这个游戏。玩这个游戏期间的三四个月，我感觉自己不只是在玩一个游戏，而是又得到一个人生。在丛林、狭居、大城市、他乡和异世界之间不断穿梭，由懵懂无知到博览群书，了解种族之间的历来纠纷并且一马当先化解恩怨。
这时候谁还记得我们一开始只是因为把冰淇淋弄到整个走廊被赶出狭居才发生的这些故事呢？
故事线中，能很清晰感受到自己的成长。一路上认识了许多最后陪我们走下来的伙伴，也有不少过客。人物性格非常饱满，有时甚至会认为他们是真实存在的：一个整天喊着你无赖的小鹦鹉，每次都能在你最需要的时候为你解答；一位将你赶出去的洁癖房东，却能在你返还时用傲娇的语气劝你留下；就算是游乐园里那个神神叨叨的预言者，也会在拿了你太多钱后向你坦白道歉，吐露心声。（虽然钱还是没有还回来。）
这个游戏里充满了太多的感动啊。
到最后一战结束，世界里最大的boss和他的老朋友握手言和的时候，当所有伙伴坐下来聊天的时候，未来也用一种最常用的幻灯片呈现出来。每个人都拥有了它们最完美的结局。种族抛弃往事重归于好，房东离开狭居如愿在大城市安定，电梯服务员也去了游乐园享受它向往依旧的生活，三位老者一起开办学堂，两个曾剑拔弩张的种族开始玩起了球类游戏。
而我们的hero呢，就等待着新的机遇，在世界里不断游荡。
不是因为没有家，是因为这个世界的任何一个地方，都是自己的家。
我很感谢这个游戏带给我的一切。
现在谈一谈游戏体验。手感很好，键位舒适，没有特别难的谜题。交互丰富，情节自然。似乎都是优点呢。
缺点的话，从我的角度来看，我不是很喜欢这个汉化。我玩的时候还没有出官方中文，仗着自己稍微有点词汇量我直接玩的。这个游戏需要的词汇量的确不大，有很多很出彩的人名地名。但是中文似乎看起来有些粗糙，配不上这个蛮好的游戏。我倒是很希望官方能给我一次锻炼的机会，让我来汉化这个游戏呢：D。Please let me do the translation!!!!
以及地图。我希望选项中能够有自由开关小地图的地方。不要问为啥，看着别扭qwq
除了这些好像还真的没有可以挑剔的地方呢w
结论：不推荐。因为它太好了，不想分享给别人XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198117169411', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1545818824}
review:
游戏细节还算是有趣, 但是中后期过于繁琐.
最终boss的设计也是一大败笔:
    伤害判定点在眼睛, 但是本来射击距离短的情况下, boss会闭眼, 还飞的很高, 周围还有一群小怪挡子弹. 完全是为了难而难. 本来玩的还算开心, 结果快结束了给玩家喂shi. 
只能说打折的话可以考虑入一下, 原价个人觉得不值.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323486943', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1529203630}
review: Es un juego que tiene una historia muy bonita, trata sobre una bolita que la corrieron de su departamento y tiene que hacer amigos y favores para poder regresar a casa. Sin duda una muy buena trama y estoy conforme con la jugabilidad y la dificultad al ser un juego de plataformas creo que acertaron con eso.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990810741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1538960384}
review: I don't do many reviews, but it's hard for me to not write one up for this game. This became my favorite indie game. The music is great, the sound effects and art is adorable and works so well. The world felt like it kept going. Side activities and bosses that you wouldn't expect. Combat is so simple yet it works so well with what it is. There's really nothing missing. There's even choices to make your Wuppo have even more character. There collectibles are worth grabbing in the game and the history of the world is terrific to listen to.

review:
처음엔 귀엽다고 생각해서 편한마음으로 구매를하였고 힐링게임이겠구나 했습니다.
처음부터 도전한 난이도는 어려움이었고크게 어렵다고 느끼지않구 재밌었습니다
 중간중간의 퍼즐이 정말 재밌었구 보스전두 인상깊었습니다 하지만 프내커들과의 보스전이 다른보스전에비해 빈약한것같아서 정말아쉬웠습니다 스토리상으론 함께 프내커들을 싱크홀로 보냈다고했을때 프내커들이 개개인이 정말강하기 떄문이라고 생각하였고 프내커들과 처음 조우했을때 정말 좋았습니다만 프내커들과의 보스전은 그렇게 재밌지않았습니다 . 물론다른 보스전은 정말좋았습니다!
다음에도 재밌는게임하나 만들어주세요!

author: {'steamid': '76561198346995559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2301, 'last_played': 1630396660}
review:
可爱。团子=嘟+哒哒哒+pon咚pon咚+咕噜咕噜。
几乎没有挑战承受力的元素，全年龄向，前三章的剧情可以当睡前故事讲。
有自由探索空间，一点小惊喜。
为了游戏体验推荐倒卖咖啡，省时间，收入虽然有上限但基本够用。
至于要不要推荐给女朋友，因人而异吧，毕竟大家的女朋友都不一样。

author: {'steamid': '76561197961969805', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1545178185}
review: Kinda cute and silly, but the actual game design is meh. Most of the puzzles are kinda weird and arbitrary and it's easy to miss things that make the game more frustrating and difficult. The boss fights are neat but not actually that challenging and the parts between them are mostly a drag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189539803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1544965869}
review:
连续肝了两天时间，突然地就结局了，画风嘛。。怎么说，不知道是说抽象还是粗制滥造好。。。。
但是我这种看惯巫师3这种画质的人，竟然没对这种画风有任何困扰。
故事情节嘛，中庸，无名小英雄拯救世界的套路。
这个游戏有几个小细节十分有意思，
1.你必须排队，在游乐场、车站，海关，等等，只要前面有人，你是不能强制插队的，如果你要硬闯，会弹出对话框叫你乖乖排队，就光看这点，就会觉得制作组满满的善意，更是考虑到这种画风和角色设定，应该是给7-12岁的小孩子玩的（但是身为18岁的高中生我竟然不知廉耻的打通关），着一设定无疑给孩童建立了正确的三观，给制作组点赞！
2.制作团队将每个角色刻画得十分鲜明，尤其是lift wum ，虽然是个枯燥的工作依然培养出了对其的兴趣，小老弟对此十分佩服

说一个我卡关的地方吧，在popo city 到达10000 credit 的时候，所有员工都会停止工作，然而我那个时候还没买潜水盔，而且我钱也是不够，要640，然后呢纠结了好久，原本要去工厂才七巧板但是踩了五分钟，管老板要钱的时候竟然赖着不发工钱。。那好吧，查攻略才知道  [spoiler]可以卖好的鱼钩钓到码头那个人的帽子给她就会得到传奇鱼钩，然后用传奇鱼钩就可以钓到潜水盔[spoiler]
就是这样，
还有的是，那个神自己的空间很美，希望制作住可以环绕那个星球出dlc剧情

author: {'steamid': '76561198799218363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1604317473}
review:
스토리는 무난한 편입니다. 귀여운 그래픽이랑 잘 어울려요. 조작이 쉽고 화면 배치가 잘 되어있어요. 횡스크롤 RPG를 좋아한다면 재밌게 할 수 있습니다.

기본적으로 스토리를 따라가는 게임이지만 가볍게 즐길 수 있는 부가 컨텐츠도 다수 있습니다. 비슷한 장르의 게임중에서는 비교적 자유도가 높은 편인거 같아요. 아이템컬렉션이나 서브스토리를 모으는것도 세밀하게 되어있어서 지루하지 않아요. 기본 난이도 기준으로 보스는 패턴만 외우면 쉽게 잡는 편이니까 비슷한 게임을 많이 해보신 분들은 난이도를 높여서 시작하는걸 추천합니다. 후반부에 가서는 복잡한 퍼즐이 나오는데 좀 어이없고 햇갈릴뿐이지 어렵지는 않아요. 진짜 개쉬움.

메인스토리를 제외, 사람에 따라서 불친절하거나 맵이 어렵다고 느낄 수 있습니다. 게임 플레이에 크게 지장이 가지는 않습니다. 엔딩까지는 거의 3~4시간, 여유롭게 하면 7~8시간 정도 걸립니다.


아쉬운점은 잘 나오지 않는 종족이 있다는거... 마을 하나 더 만들어줬으면 좋겠어요. 한 시리즈 43까지 나와도 ㅇㅋ입니다 귀여우니까.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838413613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1542, 'last_played': 1559098713}
review:
워포는 정말 최고의 게임입니다.

좀 막히는 부분도 있긴 하지만 그건 영상 참고하면서 보면 되기도 하고 해서 괜찮았어요 :)

뭔가 참신하고 귀여운 세계관과 귀염뽀짝한 동글동글한 NPC들,
그리고 근사한 이름들이 진짜 좋았고
각각의 장소들? 의 일러도 약간 손으로 그린 듯한 감이 있어서 좋았습니다.

이거 덕분에 점프 컨트롤 연습도 많이 됐고 점프맵 류에 대한 실력을 키운 느낌.

스토리의 전개도 뭔가 괜찮았습니다. 

여튼간에 결론은 워포 갓겜.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987215346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1698864609}
review:
I wanted to buy something and this was "overwhelmingly postive", so I thought, "heh, why not"?
I didn't watch any of the trailers and pretty much went in blind, expecting an ok platform-game with some interactable characters.

Negative
-
There should be more places to explore, and random quests to do 
More generic NPCs should be interactable
Maybe add different ways to complete or bypass certain areas

Positive
-
Far exceeded what I had expected; really felt like an adventure-RPG game instead of a boring/annoying platform game.
The boss fights didn't feel like you were being trapped into a "boss zone", but rather happened naturally and organically.
The platform jumping parts weren't frustrating

===
I couldn't find any notable problems in this game

It's a very good game. The quality is there, as well as a long game length.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099702246', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1544729403}
review:
Wuppo es un juego visualmente bonito y con entornos muy vivos. Pese a su apariencia infantil, el juego sí es considerablemente desafiante y demanda lectura y comprensión, de otro modo es facil perderse y no saber qué hacer, por lo cual es una lástima que no esté en Español. Los jefes tienen una dificultad considerable y varias veces te van a patear el trasero antes de que puedas ganarles. 

Definitivamente recomiendo jugarlo con Mouse y teclado porque el combate con control es muy malo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287871245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1631271291}
review:
感谢谜之声的推荐，看了一集实况之后直接过来买游戏了，一开始打根本就停不下来啊。游戏非常非常非常的可爱，真实的排队和等车系统让我想起了小时候玩的冒险岛，谜题设置得不错，npc非常非常非常可爱，每只角色都有自己的性格，重复对话有惊喜。道具的名字，城市的名字也很可爱，而且想不到的彩蛋互动特别多，你能想到的制作组都给你做出来了，置身其中感觉是一个非常真实的世界。对于我这种很少玩网游的社恐来说，呆在游戏里，看着wum来wum往，既不会引起社恐，又没有孤单感，真的太太太太棒了！游戏里还有一个游乐场！还有一个冥想室！还有蛋糕吃！还能钓鱼！还要啥自行车！
港真，我上一次这么快乐，已经是我玩FEZ的时候了，同样是像素风，同样有解谜的成分，同样隐藏着庞大的世界观，同样有精巧的世界设定，同样的惊艳。
讲一下缺点吧，最大的缺点，是这个游戏只卖48。
刚入游戏的时候有点掉帧，重开几次，调一下画面设置之后就好了。之前有玩家说游戏地图太大而且乱，制作组已经在游戏里加上了小地图。
总之是一个非常棒的游戏，感谢15个小时纯粹的快乐。

author: {'steamid': '76561197997045080', 'num_games_owned': 2087, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1544122917}
review:
A very unique metroidvania game that took me by surprise.

I've not heard about the game before installing it and had actually no idea about the game play as well. To my surprise this did not turn out to be a lemmings clone but an interesting adventure platformer.

The visuals are a bit off putting at first with a hand drawn art style. But it somehow fits the games theme and if nothing else its consistent throughout. Some areas do look better others but luckily there's just a handful of ugly areas. But you do get used to it and as mentioned it does fit the game.

The game is a mixture of platformer and adventure game. The world has surprisingly quite deep lore despite being a little silly. But you do get attached to all the wums, fnakkers, blussers and other creatures inhabiting the world and they are a quite lovable bunch. The dialogs are well written and really funny at times.

Platforming is solid and the boss fights quite well designed. Challenging but rewarding with a very good boss design and variety. 

The adventuring is a bit old school. The game does not lead you by the hand and very often you're left to your own to figure things out. This can be both good and bad and I'll admit I was forced to use a guide here and there but figuring stuff on my own was very rewarding I'll admit.

So whats bad about the game. For starters it lacks a clear goal. For most of times it feels like giving you little goals but without proper motivation. And it feels like you're not sure what to do. You're forced to explore and eventually you figure out your next move but there's never a good "why" - things just sort of happen.

Some puzzles especially later on are extremely annoying, hard and frustrating making me drop a star from the final score. The last boss is unnecessarily too long and it's not always super easy to keep track of what's going on in the screen due to colorful chaos.

Overall it was a great ride though. A joy for sure and a feel-good kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347845029', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1542029813}
review:
磕磕绊绊拖了几个月终于一周目普通难度全收集通关了~
结识Wuppo是散人某天的直播里，在蔚蓝和一众i wanna的衬托下这款萌萌的游戏显得对手残尤为美好TAT果断买下开启了Wum的旅程！
整体来说是包含平台跳跃和解谜要素的RPG，还是一言不合就拯救了世界的套路hhhh如果用一个词来概括这款游戏那肯定就是“可爱”了！
缺点就是主线不太明确，不过我通关的时候制作组已经添加了一定的指引，虽然目前来看还有完善的空间。

author: {'steamid': '76561198094314033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1543646338}
review:
Wuppo is an adorable metroidvania full of charm. The characters can be pretty humourus and the game offers some dialogue choices for futher interaction (depending on your choice your wum even makes different expressions or mumbles the words at a different speed). The game does have a few standard enemies, but the combat mainly takes place in boss battles in which you essentially shoot blobs of gum at your foes. The boss fights were pretty memorable in that some of them popped up out of nowhere and the boss designs themselves are all distinguishable and unique. 

I would say the only issues I had with the game were relatively minor and mainly me nitpicking some things. I wish you could equip a usable item, such as a weapon, and some accessories at the same time, such as cosmetic outfits. 
I personally played using a controller and this made the game a bit more difficult as all movement is done with the left control stick (meaning no d-pad for precision movement) and equipment hotkeys are restricted to the d-pad and a few face buttons. There are quite a few items I liked to have on hand so having to go into the menu to rebind things was a little annoying sometimes. I also found the max jump height hard to achieve which made some platforms difficult to get over. These are all minor complaints on the whole though.

This game has so many nice details in it that just make me happy. I mentioned that your wum can change expression, but they can change color based on what they have done, such as turning a pale green for a while after getting nauseous. The game has an internal clock that events like the day/night cycle and some transportation arrival times are based on. The game also has some segments where you can wait in a line and the other characters get angry if you try to cut in front of them. There is also a bit of background lore that can be discovered, but it is entirely optional and isn't neccesary to enjoy the game.

Overall, if you want a cute, relaxing platformer to play and that isn't really that difficult or frustrating, then play Wuppo. You'll have a good time :D

review:
Wuppo is a game where you play as a wum who is kicked out of his home and is forced to find a new place to live, embark on a journey to find your place whilst fighting bosses and enemies on the way, there are plenty of npcs and game mechanics to make this game very enjoyable, the dialog is very entertaining as each option gives its own interesting result, the feeling of amazement when beating this game is incredible.
Would rate a 4/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1543392419}
review:
There are a vast array of approaches taken to platformer design, but in general you pretty much know what you’re getting. With few exceptions you run, you jump, you collect powerups, you deal with enemies and traps, and you head for your goal. What exceptions there are can be eye-opening, and Wuppo is a prime example of just such a curveball. Presented as a platformer, edging dangerously close to a metroidvania, this charming little adventure is really just a day in the life of a simple little creature in their strange, fantastic world. And it just happens to be a day that could change everything forever.

You are a wum, a tiny, spherical creature on four stubby legs. You reside in the Wumhouse, a grand edifice in which you spend your days eating ice cream and watching TV. Unfortunately you’re a bit too slovenly about it for the management, which has you booted out into the wilderness to find a more accepting home. This sets you little wum on a grand odyssey, meeting other sentients like the rowdy blions and serene blussers, learning about the long and storied history of the world, and uncovering existential threats to the wum’s way of life. There are items to find, friends to help, credit to earn, and bosses to defeat on your journey, and what starts as a search for a new pad ends with the fate of the world resting on your adorable little dome.

Now, when I talk about a “grand odyssey”, you might be envisioning something like Hollow Knight or Ori where you’re exploring a vast, untamed land. That’s really not the case in Wuppo for a couple reasons. For one, the map is mostly concentrated around the actual settlements of the wums and their peers. When you get chucked from the Wumhouse you’ll do a little hiking through the forest and some caves, but after that it’s back to civilization and the towns and cities of the world for pretty much the rest of the game. Instead of spelunking and mountain climbing, you’ll be navigating the busy streets of Popo City, and exploring the villages of other species on the edges of wum society.

The other thing about Wuppo is that it’s more of an adventure game than anything. Combat tends to be the least of your concerns here, relegated to occasional enemy appearances and the isolated boss fights. There are plenty of those, mind you, but they’re spaced out between long sections of exploring, talking, and problem-solving. Your wum has a robust inventory of items they can wear on their tiny head and huck at other creatures for whatever reason, like returning lost hats or sharing food. You’ll get some clever hat-based devices like a cleaner that spreads suds for you to scrub and eat, and a newspaper launcher that delivers papers straight to willing heads. Most items are found or received but a few can be bought and sold, exchanging smurt or wondersplenk for goods like hats and food.

You may have noticed by now that there are some colorful names floating around in this one. Perhaps Wuppo’s greatest strength is in the world it has built for you to putter around in, full of rich histories and lore for its weirdly precious inhabitants. The optional filmstrip collectibles scattered throughout the game will teach you all about the shared history of the wums, blussers, splenkhakkers, and fnakers, as well as how Popo City and the Wumhouse came to be, where kneft come from, why the city runs on credit instead of smurt, and far more eclectic secrets than this. It’s all told with a familiar charm and hilarious writing, from the tall tales of Burt Smulder to the intense drive of Uberhenk. It’s adorable through and through, and encourages loads of exploration just to see more of the charm tucked away here.

The rich presentation helps a lot, because Wuppo can feel like a rather aimless game at times. Like I said, it’s not really an epic quest or a series of challenges, it’s just your little wum trying to find their place in the world. You’ll have objectives at any given time but they’re things like “find a new place to live” and “earn some credit”. It’ll take some effort to figure out what you should be doing next and how to do it, and in the early parts of the game before the full scope of events becomes clear, this can make it hard to stick with. My first attempt at playing Wuppo ended about two hours in, when I got stumped trying to get to Popo City and lost interest in the game. I needed a few clues to point me in the right direction the second time I played, but once I actually GOT to Popo City the game picked up significantly and kept me engaged all the way through the mind-bending conclusion.

You may also run afoul of technical issues on this one, owing to its GameMaker roots. Wuppo can be extremely temperamental about refresh rates, slowing down or speeding up to uncomfortable degrees. A few of the events can break as well, particularly the lines in Wondersplenk when you’re waiting to get on a ride. And that’s another thing, in the game’s quest to simulate an actual little society, there are things you need to wait in line for. The train between the Wumhouse and Popo City actually runs on a five-minute rotation, meaning you might be sitting at the station whistling (there’s a dedicated whistle button) as you arbitrarily wait to get on with the game.

These issues make Wuppo a bit more of a challenge to get into than more conventional platformers, but that’s also the beauty of it. Wuppo is a very different kind of platformer, one that’s not afraid to confuse you with its strange histories or unexpected conventions. It’s a game where you’re not a hero, you’re really just some little jerk who ends up making more of a difference than you’d ever expect, in ways you won’t be expecting either. It’s unique, which is rare for a platformer, but still manages to be unrelentingly fun. And that’s the thing, if you can get over the initial weirdness and hurdles, Wuppo rewards you with some of the happiest, most charming gameplay around.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]

review:
说真的这游戏的主线做的真的很乱……我身边所有玩这个游戏的人都觉得玩的十分痛苦，经常不知道要干什么（扶额）
主线提示过少，解密经常卡关，打boss的时候我连主角在哪里都看不清
画风可爱是可爱，但是经常卡关在几个场景里转来转去，地图画的跟废稿一样，我真的很烦躁，看见主角就想吐

推荐养生休闲玩家尝试，不推荐喜欢跑剧情的玩家购买

如果有详细的攻略，我会改变对这个游戏的看法，在有条理的攻略的引导下想必会有很不一样的游戏体验，毕竟剧情还是很有趣很治愈的
但我个人并没有发现易于参考的攻略，新人游戏体验真的极差

author: {'steamid': '76561198107365945', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1596075801}
review:
This game was really fun. I bought the Humble Bundle it came with for Nuclear Throne, but I ended up checking Wuppo out for the art style. 
+ Lots of secrets to be found if you want to explore the world--and the aesthetic really made me want to explore it.
+ Solid gameplay and fun bosses.
- Would have liked some more flavor text with other characters/items/etc.
-Sometimes getting money is a pain.
Minor issues aside, definitely check this one out. It's great to be a Wum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021625231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1537841630}
review:
I don't have much to say about this game, because it's just soo extremely good and wonderful. It's strange, bizarre, charming, adorable, witty, with a tinge of crude in just the right ways. It absorbs you in, and gives you not only a game, but a world to experience and live in. Become one of the wuppo... Eat like the wuppo... sleep as a wuppo... and wear many funny hats... yes... like a wuppo!

Just like super metroid, games this good are just never long enough. I wish wuppo had a lot more to it, and was very sad when my adventure ended. 

Wuppo is fantastic. I do not say that very often about games, because I am very jaded. Buy it now.


Also the music is AWESOME!

review:
It's decent, but navigating to the item/equipment selection lists takes too much effort and organization seems un-intuitive.  This could be passable, but the game doesn't pause while you're trying to find things.  Good luck with the end boss if you didn't select all the right equipment before your final save. 😬

The game is otherwise charming and bizarre.

review:
진짜 이 갓-게임 한글번역 완벽 그 자체입니다. 난이도도 제법 있어서 나름 컨트롤 필요하구요.

시험만 아니었으면 하루종일 이거 붙잡고 하고 싶을만큼 재밌습니다....

author: {'steamid': '76561198053882823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1585759987}
review:
For starters i played this game on hard and completed it in under 10 hours. 

This game wasnt horrible but there were verry few things i actually enjoyed in this game save for the exploration which was a verry fun part of the game but i do not feel it in any way made up for all the flaws. The major things i had a problem with were the bossfights; the unreasonable amount of money you need for all the upgrades; and the difficulty of the game in general. 

The bossfights were nothing but tedious. The biggest problem with them were the untelegraphed attacks and the zoomed out camera. This means that dodging anything in a calm manor was imposible and just running away was usually the best option. The pattern of projectiles from bosses was seemingly random in almost all cases which isnt very good in a game like this and made the fights feel more like coinflips than a test of your skill, the last fight comes to mind. 

The upgrades felt like a big part of the game when you got to them but it is so idiotically time consuming to get the money necessarry to buy the upgrades. It just feels so pointless for it to cost so much when there already is a lack of variety in the combat. 

The third problem was how easy the game was even when playing on hard. I might not be the demigraphic they are looking for but nothing felt very challanging at all and the few deaths felt more like bad boss design or bad leveldesign, the corridors with the jellyfishes for example. 

It is in my opinion impossible for me to recommend this game with these flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804614594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1532226678}
review: 我在steam上的第一款游戏，画风可以说是很喜欢了，画面清新可爱又不显得劣质低级。集合了收集、打怪、剧情于一体，很休闲哈，自由度也比较高，情节的推动靠自己去触发，像我这种笨蛋就属于满世界跑去找下个情节触发点的那种（最后还搜了攻略T-T）。还有一些可爱的隐藏成就，总之这款游戏很适合妹子，遇见打折就赶紧收了它吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198049156087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1542047243}
review:
全方位シューティングアクション
ジャンルはメトロバニア
クリアまで11時間遊べた
アパートを汚して追い出される話
基本はペイントガンで敵を倒すゲームだが、
中盤からは特定の装備でギミックを動かして進んでいく
町のステージまで行くとウジャウジャNPCが走り回っていて何だか楽しい
結構ストーリーがしっかりしてるっぽいので英語読める人は楽しめると思う
そこそこ英語を読まないと何してるのか分からなくて詰む
収集要素は映像フィルム、持っていくと金くれたり最大ライフを上げてくれる
ゲーム内で行列に並ばされるステージがあるが、
平気で追い越しされて後ろにはじき出されるのは理不尽
種族の謎を解き明かす話っぽい
箱丸コン対応

author: {'steamid': '76561197995935865', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1541676906}
review:
湯圓冒險記

超可愛的遊戲。價格跟畫面乍看之下以為遊戲歷程很短，內容卻很豐富。

劇情是歡樂的童話式冒險故事，一支愛吃冰淇淋的宅宅Wum因為闖禍被趕出住處，展開一段探索世界、跨越不同種族城市，穿梭地上地下的旅程。遊戲中角色造型很簡單，對話內容卻歡樂有個性。場景地圖比預期的還龐大，一個城市裡面就有不少區域、場景，地圖上的一些物件都可以見到不少巧思設計。搭配場景的音樂也都各有特色，十分動聽。Wum雖然只是個圓球，搭配遊戲過程中取得的服裝和各種道具，讓戰鬥和解謎多了很多變化。

是個能開心享受探索與驚喜，愉快地戰鬥和解謎的好遊戲!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030232963', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1647, 'last_played': 1541886657}
review:
The Overwhelmingly Positive reviews ain't for show m8.

Wuppo is a genre-defying game that combines elements of metroidvania, shmups, platforming, puzzlers, bullet hell and RPGs, with a heavy focus on exploration in a largely open world. You'd think wew that sounds like a horrible mess but Wuppo combines all of this so effortlessly it's simply astonishing. It never gets repetitive thanks to its varied and polished gameplay.
Wuppo looks and sounds great and distinctive and has some of the best world-building I've ever seen in a video game. It's insanely cute and adorable without ever being childish. The humor is witty, sometimes subtle and always quirky. The game had me grinning like an idiot for the majority of my playtime. The premise and story are pretty basic but the world and characters just sucked me in for an immersive experience I haven't had in quite some time. There's so much to explore and silly stuff to do it's legit crazy. Everything just oozes with charme, character and soul. The attention to detail is extremely impressive.

I very rarely get post-game depression these days but Wuppo reminded me it's a thing. I never played anything like this before. I doubt there is anything like it in the first place.
The game was made by a team consisting of a whole two dudes from the Netherlands. Kudos to them. At first I thought yeah Wuppo is easily one of the best games ever developed in that country. But that doesn't do it justice; it's one of the best games ever made, period, and considering just how damn good Wuppo is, it's not even that bold a claim. It's a masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334437727', 'num_games_owned': 1822, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1541652544}
review:
游戏本身质量杠杠的，优点大家都说了很多。但是很多地方都能感觉到制作人深深的恶意，为了得到潜水服你要花大价钱才能拿到，或者在一个偏僻的不行的地方接到一个意义不明的支线你才能获得免费的潜水服，甚至这个支线都没有告诉你做完可以获得潜水服。还有后面我卡关的会客厅，不看攻略难度有多大玩过的人都知道，几乎没有任何提示，又不能多创几个存档点防止翻车，看着攻略一次错了而且你不小心跳进存档罐里那就基本是gg了。这个游戏和fez一样有主线但是不会刻意去突出主线而是去刻画出一个开放的世界，这种游戏对某些路痴玩家来说真的很容易玩懵，而且看似方便的存档制度反而还会添更多的麻烦，这是一个很棒的游戏，但是我却几乎玩的要哭了，玩家体验极差，不推荐路痴玩家游玩

居然不知道什么时候改了会客厅的机制，给回好评！

author: {'steamid': '76561197995797795', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1632702949}
review:
A very fun, lighthearted adventure.  It's all about meeting weird friends, doing silly things, and sometimes fighting scary bosses.  The world is big enough to sustain a bit of exploration, and it's full of curiosities.  To me, the game's quirky atmosphere is sincere, not affected.  That means a lot to me.

Right-click to whistle.  You won't be sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332142686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1541673218}

author: {'steamid': '76561198848554156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1585725871}
review:
玩了大概45分钟，游戏体验很好，没想到居然是两年前的游戏哎。先是被游戏本身画风吸引到，从场景、BGM到武器的样式，个人认为都是充满可爱的味道φ(≧ω≦*)♪，然后真的被Wum可爱到，玩的中途拿了一下外卖....回来的时候Wum就在打盹睡觉(ฅ>ω<*ฅ) ，不得不说真的很喜欢这种萌萌的生物，Wum下蹲时候的样子也是特别的可爱，像棉花糖一样，真的有击中自己的少女心。
操作感觉还是挺简单的，挺适合新手的，自己选了BOSS的简单难度，可以说是无敌简单了，属于手残本人的福音，就是找路还是需要探索探索的.....刚刚玩甚至找不到路orz。除了BOSS以外，收集胶卷这一点也很吸引人，个人认为世界观是很有吸引力的，个人很萌种族设定( •̀∀•́ )。玩了没多长时间，很期待后面的剧情，玩的时候心情真的超好!!
真心推荐这款游戏，真滴好！啊啊真的好可爱(๑•́ωก̀๑)
