author: {'steamid': '76561198046729068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1702866222}
review: This is a good game. Is this a kid's game? Yes, yes it is. It's a good kids game though. I think it's charming for me with its child-like version of the world and unique/engaging personalities. Dressed up cotton balls running around everywhere, a "small" accident occuring in the beginning, and very funny dialogue options and choices. This is a well made game with a unique world. Not every part of the game is important to the story, and I like how the world just has so many unnecessary locations and wuppos everywhere. It makes it feel like a bustling city, to a chaotic amusement park, to a small village more there and in the moment.

review: Al ver este juego me recordó mucho a uno de mis juegos favoritos de Super Nintendo: Yoshi's island, me gustan los plataformeros, y este fue una de las sugerencias, mire un gameplay, me llamó la atención, lo compré, lo comencé a jugar y cada nuevo nivel me encantó más. Una grata sorpresa, me atrapó el mundo que crearon alrededor de estas bolitas con ojos y cuatro patas. Gracias a los creadores que siempre están actualizandolo a pesar de tener algunos años de haber salido, agregando cosas que no sabía que necesitaba, como el mapa. Esperando el próximo juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031617164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1541087517}
review:
워포

어드벤쳐 액션 RPG 퍼즐 게임.
귀여운 캐릭터와 잘 짜여진 판타지 세계관이 멋있음.

보스 몬스터를 잡고, 여러 아이템을 모아 퍼즐을 푸는,
조금 전형적인 RPG 게임임.
다만 레벨이나 스탯같은 복잡한 시스템은 없고,
아이템과 체력만 업그레이드 할 수 있었음.
나는 간단한 RPG를 좋아하기 때문에, 이 점은 상당히 좋았음.

처음에는 트레일러를 안 보고 캐릭터만 봐서
캐주얼 플랫포머 퍼즐 게임인줄 알고 플레이했는데
RPG여서 좀 당황했음. ㅋㅋ

한 가지 아쉬웠던 점은 탐험할 수 있는 맵 전체가 좀 작다고 느껴짐...
재밌어서 더 그랬던 부분.

분위기가 약간 몽환적임. 그래서 좋음.
스토리도 정말 맘에 들고.
플레이도 꽤 재밌음.
정신없이 플레이 함.
이 정도면 명작이라고 불러도 될 듯.
추천.

참고로 공식 한글화가 되어 있음.

진행도: 보통 난이도로 엔딩 봄.
필름 다 모음. 보스 다 물리침. (히든 보스 포함.)
행복은 100개 다 모음. 
도전과제는 다 안 깸. 보스런은 안 함.
DLC는 아직.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039670199', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1587132488}
review:
Really great game! 
The story, worldbuilding and character of the game really got to me. It's just really cute, but at the same time has a bit of meaning. Music's amazing as well, especially during bossfights. 
The gameplay is really fun and engrossing, and I know that this is a bit of an old meme, but this game seriously is the Dark Souls of 3+ games. I played it on Hard, and quite a few of the bosses took me like 10+ tries to beat.  Really rewarding to finish a section. There's a difficulty option even above that as well. If you're looking for a more casual expereince, then there's also a Medium and an Easy mode I believe. And the puzzles are interesting, but not too hard to beat in case you're like me and aren't usually that great at puzzles.

I got to the end in 13 hours, but I'm pretty sure I didn't see everything there was to see, so I'll definitely start another game.


I only got 1(2?) bugs, very minor stuff as well, the rest of the game ran perfectly.
The only weird bug I got was that the Current Objective thing in the menu didn't show anything? It showed up as a popup when I re-entered the game, but not in the menu where you select character, filmstrips, etc. Also I got a weird clipping thing I don't think was supposed to happen during the Chef fight? Where I popped up 2/3 of the way through. Not sure if that was supposed to happen, I beat it on the first attempt. If it was, then it looked a bit weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057929290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1562390398}
review:
켜여우면 모든것이 용서되는 게임...!!

놀이동산가서 놀이기구도 타 볼수 있고 기차도 타고 먹을 것도 사 먹을 수 있고

점도 봐 볼수 있고 신분배달도 해볼 수 있고 여튼 이것저것 해 볼수 있다.

정식 한글이기땜에 플레이에 불편한것도 없음!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081909939', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1539835492}
review:
tl;dr - Everything is simply amazing EXCEPT the story isn't long enough. But the game is filled with enough side-stuff to make up for it.

Simple, funny, charming, very fun, great music, engaging story set in an intriguing world... but it's just waaaay too short. If you get this game on sale or through Humble Bundle, then that's great. Play it and enjoy the heck out of it!

But I felt like this game only had 3 levels... Sure, there are a LOT of side missions. And they're all fun. My issue is that I beat the game when my completion rate was only at 58%. I didn't even *want* to beat it that early. But it just ended so quickly (I wasn't trying to speedrun at all).

Back to side missions (and other side-stuff). There's just so much to enjoy. All the dialogues, all the side missions, all the little interactions and things to discover. The devs have put so much into this game and I have disliked none of it.

- At full price: I'm iffy to recommend. Some will *love* it; some may be disappointed. It all depends on how willing you are to explore the game.
- On sale: I *highly* recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395160808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1539805051}

author: {'steamid': '76561198411650534', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1542022027}
review:
关于这款游戏
失去家园后，寂寞的巫姆 (wum) 必须全世界游历，以找到一个新居住地。从大都会天堂泡泡城 (Popocity) 到大而空的布莱克波利斯 (Bliekopolis)，我们的巫姆 (wum) 将发现神奇的地方，并遇到独特的生物。但巫姆 (wum) 是不平凡的英雄，只有用机智和魅力，才能在这趟巨大的旅程中成功。 

Wuppo 是一个二人激情的项目，配置有手工绘制的视觉效果、广泛的配乐以及待探索的巨大世界。
特点
探索一个充满了巫姆 (wum)、弗南克 (Fnakkers) 和其他独特生物的奇妙世界。
解决古老的冲突，追寻一个新的家园。 
使用项目和社会技能，以克服不同的挑战。
战斗从小到大，到巨大的众多敌人！
收集胶卷以探索世界的详细历史。
享受迷人和令人难忘的配乐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198801615440', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1527222395}
review:
게임 중 나오는 이름들이 좀 어려워서 스토리 이해하는데 헷갈릴 수 있지만 집중해서 보면 스토리도 재미있고, 보스들도 다들 개성이 있어서 쓰러뜨리는 재미가 있었어요. 다만 길 찾는 난이도는 꽤 있었습니다.
게임을 하다 보니 어느새 엔딩크레딧이 뜨더군요..
이제 중간정도 클리어 했겠구나 싶었는데...
캐릭터들이 상당히 귀여워서 게임내내 즐겁게 할 수 있었습니다.
업데이트는 딱 봐도 없을 것으로 보이니, 시즌 2가 나오면 사지는 않겠지만 응원하겠습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447765441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1658058426}
review:
나만의 작은 힐링겜. 하지만 그 세계관은 의외로 전혀 작지 않고 매력적이다.

마음이 너무 고단해서 게임을 쌓아두고 정작 플레이를 못하는 인간. 근데 워포는 낮은 진입장벽에 귀여운 그림체, 귀여운 배경 때문에 힘들 때에도 힐링 목적으로 플레이가 가능하다. 그렇게 게임은 하고싶은데 다른 겜을 할 엄두는 안 나고, 무해하고 귀여운 워포를 했을 때의 만족감 때문에 겜하고 싶을때 이것만 켜다 보니 나도 모르게 이만큼이나 했구나.

겜은 하고 싶은데 정신적인 에너지를 바치고 싶진 않고, 힐링이 하고 싶은 사람에게 추천.


+스토리가 매력적이다. 개발자 당신들의 세계관을 더 체험하고 싶다. 내가 힘들 때에도 뭔갈 체험할 수 있게 해줬던 이 게임의 귀여운 디스플레이, 캐릭터, 배경으로 게임이 더 나온다면 내 인생은 조금 더 행복해질 것 같다..

author: {'steamid': '76561198307379664', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1559477316}

The game has it's own great humor and very interesting but adorable characters xd Would recommend this if you want a cute game with a lot of action. cute action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335578252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1520082855}

author: {'steamid': '76561198861534808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1696010056}
review:
재미, 스토리, 연출 그 모든 것을 다 갖춘 자유로운 영화.
모든 요소를 꼼꼼히 탐험하는 것을 좋아하는 사람에겐 적극 추천!

처음 좋아하는 스트리머가 추천을 받아서 하는 것을 보고, '완두콩 같은 귀여운 생명체가 물감으로 공격을 하다니! 사야겠군!' 하는 호기심으로 게임을 깔았다. 평범한 모드로 플레이를 했는데 그때는 게임의 난이도가 어렵다고 생각해서 한 시간을 하고 주말로 미뤄버렸다. 그러나 지금 생각해보면 게임의 자유도가 높고, 맵이 크고, 내 게임 경험도에 의해 어렵다고 느낀 것이지 플레이하는데 크게 어려움은 없었다. 적당한 난이도였다.

종족에 따른 습성들이 명확하고, 캐릭터성이 좋아서 평소 자잘한 캐릭터들의 이름은 스쳐지나가는 나도 금방금방 외울 수 있었다. 이름을 모른다면 적어도 어디서 무얼했는지는 알 수 있을 정도다. 또한 필름을 통해 그들을 엿볼 수 있게 만들어주기 때문에 캐릭터에 친근함도 느낄 수 있었다.

필름에 대한 얘기를 해보자면, 스토리를 인도하는 역할과 캐릭터와 내가 친해주게 해주는 역할, 자잘한 설정 등의 설명을 해주는 역할을 해주는데 하나하나 모아서 엘리들과 틀어보며 그것을 수집하려는 욕심이 들었다. 목적이 행복이나 스멋을 얻는 것이던, 지식을 얻는 것이던 간에 게임 안에 필름을 찾는 작은 게임을 만들어놓음으로써 우리가 거대한 맵의 숨은 곳들을 알고 거기에 매력과 성취감을 느끼게 만들어준다. 필름을 모으는 시간이 스토리에 영향을 끼치지 않기 때문에 세상이 종말하기 전에도 내가 필름을 얻으려고 노력하는 건 스스로도 웃겼다.

가끔씩 이 캐릭터도 보스야? 싶은 작은 의문이 들기도 했지만, 그들로부터 스멋을 벌어 보다 여유롭게 플레이했다는 것은 이 게임의 장점이 될 수도 있을 것 같다.

몇몇 사람들은 게임에서 얻을 수 있는 스멋이 조금 적다고 말하기도 하는데,  초반에 많은 것을 투자하지 않아도 되게 만들어준다. 유물을 제외하곤 상점에서 얻지 않아도 초반엔 전부 구할 수 있도록 되어있다. 물론 조금의 귀찮음이 있긴 하지만. 또한 포포시티에서 일을 해서 돈을 얻는 방법도 있고, 찾아보면 돈을 벌 수 있는 구석이 꽤 많다.

맵은 정말 멋있다. 각각 장소에 따른 특성을 잘 표현해내었고, 정말 내가 관광을 하게 만든다. 세계를 구해야하는데 당장 내 눈앞에 있는 포포시티가 멋지니 구경도 좀 하고 먹을 것도 사고...

보통 이런 게임을 하면 엔딩에서 지쳐서 딴짓을 하는 경우가 있는데, 이어지는 스토리가 너무 좋아서 내내 집중해서 보았다. 천천히 넘어가서 여러 번 읽고 또 발견해낼 수 있었다. 크레딧까지도 집중해서 봤다. 올라가는 사람들의 이름을 보며 계속 정말 게임 잘 만들었다! 하고 괜히 뿌듯한 마음이 들었다.

마냥 귀엽다고 생각하고 산 게임이었지만 귀여움이 전부가 아닌 것도 좋았다. 스토리 면에서도 놓친 것 없이 꼼꼼했고, 수습이 굉장히 잘 되어있다.

젠더를 따로 구분하지 않고, 거기에 프레임이 씌워지지 않아 좋았다. 오랜만에 이 부분에 있어 아무 생각 없이 편하게 플레이가 가능했다.

정말 재밌었고, 이 게임이 더 비쌌어도 사고 후회가 없었을 것이다.

review: 不要被劣质的画风所欺骗，其实这个游戏非常棒，世界观、人物塑造都特别细致，唯一不足就是流程稍微短了点，有点意犹未尽，非常不错的一款独立游戏。我不经常玩游戏，而且对游戏很挑剔，作为小众向来说，这款确实能称为精品了。顺便问问DLC是新增故事吗还是只是个皮肤？

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1537825745}
review:
Very strange game

Youre a blob who gets kicked out of a hotel (?) after spilling icecream one too many times. So you search for a new home in the big city. Also everything is named like viking fart noises

Comparisions to Paper Mario arent that far off both by gameplay or style of humor. Theres actually not that much fighting (mainly bosses) or platforming but alot more talking to your fellow weird blobs, exploring and discovering all the strange stuff around and doing mini quests

Different and fun, recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198202526348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1659125417}
review: This is NOT paper mario or SoTN as an RPG. You gather items, you get rewarded for finding things, but you do not gain experience or customize your character based on how many things you kill. You are rewarded for exploring. I wanted to make that clear as when I purchased based on the reviews it seemed like a normal RPG sidescroller. That having been said, I LOVE THIS GAME. It's adorable. I wish it was longer. Highly recommend playing this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198860096279', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1632651938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041165175', 'num_games_owned': 1769, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1537416689}
review:
Wuppo is a children sketchbook with lore, personality, and simple characters design brought to life. From the humorous branching dialogue, uplifting art, and simple gameplay Wuppo is guaranteed to bring you joy. 

There is an abundance of fun to have from exploring all of the different regions of the world that the game has to offer and learning about the different tribes that exist within the game. One of the best qualities of the game is that the entire world feels interconnected and creatively alive. Activities such as fishing, characters quest lines, and the collection of films accumulate together to greatly enhance the world building. The wide range of different hats, items, and food that you find also add to help the game feel constantly fresh and exciting.

While Wuppo excels at storytelling and world building it also lacks in level design. The large majority of areas within the world value creating an immersive environment rather than providing an area that is actually enjoyable for the player to navigate. Furthermore, while the combat is flashy with the ability to constantly shoot out a barrage of colors it does lack having any great depth.

In summary, if you want a simple, fun-filled, and charming experience I would absolutely recommend Wuppo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967388488', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1596498592}
review:
I love Wuppo so much, becase it gave me something I didn't realize I wanted. 
A metroidvania exploration andventure game that's world building and lore focused instead of action

Like yeah there are some boss fights, a group of underground jellyfish that damage you if you run into them
But like 90% of the game is violence free, you are exploring the world and talking to people, and solving puzzles

And it feels, like an actual ropleplaying game almost... like that's always something that felt off is in the roleplaying games I played combat was a climatic rare note in the story, but in roleplaying computer games violence is constant and non opitonal.

The way you gain MAX HP in the game is by making people happy, I really like that. Doing nice things gives you a little extra hitpoint. People with lots of love and generosity have stronger hearts!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198218264801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1579, 'last_played': 1669583562}
review:
From the Wums to the Blussers to the Splenkhackers to the Fnakkers 

This game is amazing.

The gameplay is great, but where this game really shines is its immersion.

Any time your in a city or at the theme park. or in the wum house it feels so alive.

Wums running around. Jobs you can do. People to talk to.

You can be a part of a debate in city hall or go on a ride in the theme park.

And so much of this is optional. you can skip past all that stuff and just finish the game in a few hours. (But I recommend you look around and explore the world).

When in the city you feel like your a part of it with all the other wums bouncing around.

This game is amazing with its characters, dialogue, gameplay, locals, and story. (The backstory is suprisingly good too).

I love this game and i'm sure you will too.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994670126', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1538381912}
review: I'm on my final mission, but I couldn't help to share my review now. The game is truly magical! I was initially put off with the childish and seemingly low-res graphic designs. Boy, I was in for a big surprise! Wuppo seems to have all the ingredients right. Game mechanics, map-size, worlds distinction, puzzles complexity, boss fights, game length, are all set at the right amount. Hard but fun, simple yet engaging. I'm loving it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198316626394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1539567730}
review:
特别特别特别特别推荐！！！现在居然打折了我好难过哦（泣
可爱的小wum的冒险故事！还有人家胖不是因为冰淇淋是因为吃了电视机啦...？
过多的溢美之词我就不讲了！这里以个人游戏体验来做几个提醒：
当你的水桶没有[spoiler]在迷宫内[/spoiler]升级到两星时，不要去做[spoiler]海上[/spoiler]三星水桶任务，会导致你的水桶空有三星外貌但是无法使用！
过图时不用过于担心钱的问题，都是足够的甚至还有大量溢出！[spoiler]真的不够了的话建议倒买倒卖哦❤[/spoiler]
游戏内过图提示过少，如果遇到问题建议不要死磕找实况或者测评吧！有的时候这块地方是真的没有东西了:p
城市地下河（下水道？）part的时候稍微稍微有点可怕，鼓足勇气去钓鱼吧！
推荐射速最高的枪枪改造哦！
简单模式一周目三个半小时就可以结束啦←不是全收集哦> <

author: {'steamid': '76561197965397531', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1537081609}
review:
A terrific, compelling, charming, funny game - one full of adorable characters that you want to - and get to - become friends with. It's incredible that such a small team was able to produce this. It really should receive more attention!

The writing is great. Everybody is worth talking to. Even all of the text describing things like items is good - much like your character, you'll just devour everything in this game. The settings are varied and meaningful. Stepping off the train into Popocity gave me a strange feeling of entering a city unlike in any other game I've played (even something like GTA). The forests and caves and buildings are all great, full of detail and polish. And there are save "buckets" smartly placed just about everywhere, so while dying can and does happen quickly at times, especially facing one of the 19 bosses, you're almost never more than a few seconds away from where you left off. This game has zero filler. It doesn't make you do things twice. It's brisk. It's swift. 

The sense of progression is great. And I have no problem with the overall length of the game... I certainly didn't do everything, and I think I missed at least one area to visit, but I clocked about 7 hours at "The End" screen. I like that length. But the pacing does get a little weird at the end. It feels kind of abrupt. The quality of writing is so high throughout the game, I guess I expected some more things to call back to the beginning, some characters to show up, some of the game's early challenges to reappear in new ways. But it kinda just goes off an a tangent, and then - that's it! (And for a game about making friends, basically, it IS a bit odd that violence solves so many issues, but, oh well, it's fun.) I guess it's a testament to this game's quality that I did want more. I would have loved another large area or two to explore.

In almost every way, this game exudes polish. From its soundtrack to its menu interface to its inventory system and the items (and friends) you'll discover, it's constantly impressing me. Even the art, which may look a bit sloppy at first glance, has a structure and consistency that grew on me rapidly, even evoking a bit of Yoshi's Island for me (especially the larger-than-life bosses). I would definitely recommend this game, and I look forward to more projects from Knuist & Perzik!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030494641', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1606400195}
review:
I started playing this game with the expectation that it would be 
a shooty shoot game loaded with action, instead, what i got was 
a nice story about societies that developed from simple principles.
There is a lot to read on this game, i have beaten it in 13 hours 
of gameplay according to steam, and only got 3 achievements, i 
needed to check twice to make sure that the game didn't glitch out 
and had not given me my acievements, but no, the regular playthrough 
will only give you 3 achievements. This runs away from the trope that 
games gives you rewards for everything.

I think that one feature that i felt it was missing was the hability
to fast travel, the world gets quite big, even with the shortcuts that
the game gives us, it takes quite some time to back track. I know you
get the fast travel at the end of the game, because plot reasons, 
but it would be nice to have it at the beginning.

It took me a while to complete this game, not because the game is too
long to beat, but because i wanted to explore it, because it made me
curious of the environment around me. As stated before, this game is not
too much about shooting, you will only need to fight your way out of
problems [i]mostly[/i] on boss fights, and because of that, the game can get
you out of guard pretty easily, because you don't kind of don't practice
fighting a lot during the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018812372', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1518312532}
review: It just felt boring and unengaging. While the art was mostly nice and cute, it felt like a chore to figure out where to go and how to defeat bosses. The level design felt punishing from minor slips (having you to scaffold an entire section again just for a single mistake, repeatedly) and unmotivating. It just could not hold my attention though I tried multiple times. And I *like* Metroidvanias and fantasy worlds. Maybe there was just too much slapstick comedy all over the place to the point of nausea. To anyone on the fence, I would highly recommend first trying out a demo of any kind if they ever make one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007428578', 'num_games_owned': 1809, 'num_reviews': 382, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1536781781}
review:
Wuppo is a cute metroidvania where you play a small little creatue called a Wum who lives with a load of other Wums in a giant hotel. Unfortunately your Wum is a lazy guy who gets kicked out of the hotel for spilling ice cream all over the halls. If you think that description of the games start is strange, well it pretty much sums up the strange but likeable world of Wuppo.

Most of the game is spent exploring different locations, completing quests and fighting bosses. Most of the combat in the game revolves around the bosses. Early in the game you get a gu which shoots colourful gumballs which you use to fight the bosses. The boss fights are pretty enjoyable. They offer a decent challenge initially without being too punishing, though once you've figured out the bosses attack patterns they are easy enough to beat.

You'll meet a lot of strange and quirky characters throughout the game and some interesting locations like the Wondersplenk, a big theme park, and Popo City which is an underground city full of Wums. I enjoyed the games artstyle which looks right out of a childs colouring book and the music suits the game perfectly.

My only criticism is that there were a couple of occasions where I wasn't really sure how to proceed. The game doesn't always do a good job of nudging you in the right direction.

Overall though I quite liked Wuppo. It's a strange little game but it such a cute and charming game that it won me over quickly.

review: If you are feeling down and life is hard for you...Wuppo is here for you to change how you feel...it will make you feel happy AF thanks to the awesome songs full of joy and the conversations and the funny graphics are the perfect combination to the formula of Happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052941330', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 472, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1536536795}
review: Wuppo is a wonderful game and one definitely worth your time. It oozes of charm. In fact, I'd say it has a charm similar to the Paper Mario games, where the world and characters get a lot of attention. The writing is great, and the world is a ton of fun to explore. Some puzzles are a bit vague, though, so it might not always be easy to know what to do, but it's not bad by any means. The shoot-em-up gameplay is also a lot of fun, elthough I wish there were a few more enemies when you explore. Still, this isn't a game to be missed. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061802827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1536519334}
review:
This game captured my attention in full-force.With a unique (and very cute) aesthetic, surprisingly deep lore and deceptively challenging gameplay, Wuppo was a blast from start to end - but I'm sure I'll be back for all those filmstrips! 

My only gripe is that occassionally the puzzles seemed to expect quite a convoluted answer from the player, but it was absolutely worth it to see what came next. This was wonderful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395093446', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1683345084}
review:
I think I'm the 1001th review, 1002th review or the 1000th review.
I have not played this game for long, only ~30 hours, but the time I have played this game has changed me.
I came to this game thinking it was gonna be just a very short little game that I could play and be done with. But no, there is much more to see. It took me 30 hours to get paast my first playthrough, and I didn't even go into every room or get everything there is to get. There is 100 happiness points, and 1 in the demo. I only got 39. There is around 25 filmstrips. I only got 12. This game has so much to offer.
The soundtrack is magnificent. It consists of calm music, funky music and super upbeat fighting music. Some areas are just amazing to walk through. Once, I fell asleep due to one of the songs. (Wumhouse Night)
The gameplay is magnificent.
The physics are amazing.
The plot is whacky but outstanding.
The background sounds are beautiful. Although I wish they added a new area that added snow.
The bosses are easy and great to pick up.
This game is a great speedrun.
The DLC is awesome.
The four species are all different and are tuned greatly.
Wondersplenk is hot. 


Check out this game. And if you can, buy it for all your friends.
Because it's going to be fun.

https://discord.gg/t5YqxDG < Knuist & Perzik Community Server

author: {'steamid': '76561198375070250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1530581593}
review:
I'm glad other people enjoyed this game... but after I beat it I realized I just can't recommend it.

It's a basically decent game to me, but it feels... hollow. Like, the art is super cute, and the gameplay mechanics are sound in theory... but the jerky movement of your character and the awkward-but-you-start-with-it double feels very clunky.

And the levels... oh dear god the level design is soooo bad in this game. Don't get me wrong, it's cute to look at, but holy he11 the levels are just absurdly poor design. First off, they're ****ing enormous. It takes a freaking age to get around in this game, and most rooms are either empty or effectively empty. There is a small amount of combat, but there are few to no power ups, so bosses are mostly a matter of having enough items and learning to play. It's fine for the first few bosses, but boy does it get old by the end. Even though it was super obvious that I was at the last boss, I still couldn't believe the game was over. It was both so short and yet took forever. The plot is thin, but 'saved' from being seen this way by how long it takes to accomplish everything (mostly due to room size). The puzzles are weird and sometimes slightly contrived, but are mostly ok.

The worst part is that it would be a fantastic kids game, except that it is *so* awkward to control.

After beating it: 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198133020803', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1535998923}
review: I'm sad that I did not like this game. I keep coming back to it hoping I finally see the game I was hoping for but that is yet to happen. This isn't a relaxing game. Although the art and the world itself are aesthetically pleasing the gameplay is frustrating. There is a ton of backtracking because half the time you don't know what you need to do. A walkthrough is pretty much essintal if you want to accomplish anything, I feel like their biggest focus in this game should have been creating a world that feels real and fun to explore but the amount of confusion on the goal always takes me out of the expirence. The combat is not really rewarding either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280360556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1568618507}
review:
플레이 4 시간:
보스런 + 탐험 + (간단한 퍼즐) 게임이다.
새로운 2d 세상을 잘 만들었다. 
나름 여러 상호작용이 있으며, (편히) 막 돌아다니는 게임이다.
보스는 난이도를 어렵게 해도, 공략에 필요한 시간이 길지 않아 생각보다 금방 잡을 수 있다.
단 그래픽은 추천할 수 없으며, 약간 불친절한 UI 등의 요소가 있다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014849103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1576749859}
review:
[i]Wuppo[/i] is an underrated gem that deserves more love. Imagine all the charm of Paper Mario (writing and music), in Metroidvania-like form (but gated by story rather than player abilities), built out into a lovingly hand-drawn, detailed, and vibrant world. It's a game bursting with personality. Play this, and experience wonder and joy.

[b]Update:[/b] I played through the game a second time after the Definitive Edition was released. The final boss fight was greatly improved, and it was worth the repeat playthrough just to experience the writing, art, and music all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806468946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1534345415}
review: 갓겜이다 아기자기한 그래픽과 적당한 보스전 거기다가 재밌는 스토리까지 더해지니 금상첨화 중간중간 퍼즐적 요소들도 재밌었다

author: {'steamid': '76561198388099277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1635435196}
review:
Love this game. Quickly after playing i started liking it more and more and I would probably not make a review of most games but I feel like this is a very special game.

The art style is cute, the soundtrack is very fitting with the atmosphere and the game has an interesting story.

The gameplay is very fun. You can go anywhere around the world of WUPPO to do stuff like talking to people and exploring the map as well as fighting a boss there or getting some special items. The bosses themselfes are creative. They have their own theme and unique ways of attacking you. The fighting aspect is rather simple but this game can pull it off perfectly.
There are also a bunch or puzzles that can actually be kind of challenging really (final puzzle cost me bout an hour to figure out) and there are a bunch of minigames and challenges you can do in the game to keep you entertained as well. 


believe me once you get invested you will spend hours upon hours playing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372700339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1539875022}
review:
啊，买了好久，今天终于玩完了。

一条事项，玩到后期有个boss可能会被错过，你需要做汤的时候，如果直接早已经集齐了所有材料，直接触发厨师boss战的话，楼下烂泥地里的兄弟战（咳咳）就会消失。
当时知道真相的我哭晕......
顺带一提，我也是，看了谜之声的b站视频来买、玩游戏的，谜叔也参与了游戏的中文翻译哦！

还有一件事。
玩出结局的我好伤心，因为，虽然在图森次元有了新家，但是我wum去不了，因为通关直接放送结尾，不能直接再玩了。

明明是个可玩性挺好的作品，而且还出来了中转站图森次元，去别的世界更加容易了吧。

但是无法看到自己拯救过的世界。

看着自动播放的推荐视频，我都要不记得自己还打过那么多boss了。









（感觉像是玩到最后主角死了一样。：）

author: {'steamid': '76561197972499798', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1534135543}
review:
I wish Steam had a Meh button.  I'm not sure what they were thinking with the combat, but it is actually kinda fun.  The story is way more funny than interesting.  Music is just ok.  The second half of the game though just drags on until it just isn't as much fun anymore and the plot seems to get more serious, which it shouldn't have bothered trying to be.  

Worth buying on sale definately, it's a fun little experience for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119498914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1677004136}
review:
You like games where you're forced to watch 10 min videos to get information about wtf to do. Or rather search up a guide what to do and how to play the game, well then you're at the right address. this game gives no knowledge unless you search around the game for stupid filmstrips and watch them. Even then its not enough and you would be better of following a guide.

Also the difficulty rating is ridiculous, easy is a walk in the park each boss you can do first try this also goes for normal. Then you wanna try hard this is were it spikes up, the game starts to become a bullit hell game were you cant get hit, now for insane its just ridicoulus. If you wanna kill all the bosses, well be ready to die 50 billion times because the normal bosses are already stupid, but there is one that is even stupider that dark chamber boss its LITTERALY bullit hell 1 health you can only get more by getting stupid ice creams. If you like bullit hell games go for it this is your game, me in this case expected a nice fun casual/adventuring game. Not a game were you almost destroy your pc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037932769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1520668643}
review:
One of the most thoroughly pleasant games I have enjoyed in a while. This is the kind of game that just oozes with wonder and fun; there are so many unnecessary but fun things to do, and so many strange little details to the game's world. Aside from a single boss fight, this game was always enjoyable and always surprising me with new, fun things to do and places to explore.

I'm not even quite sure what genre this game is. It's not quite metroidvania, it's not quite platformer, and it's not quite a collect-a-thon, though it incorporates elements of all those genres. In a weird way, the game feels like a funhouse, albeit one where everything is cute as heck and warms your cold, dead heart.

Highly recommended when you need a relaxing, uplifting experience. There is nothing quite like this game, and I really hope to see more from these developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008855183', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1548393465}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118816530', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1536633627}
review:
I feel terrible for giving this game a bad review because it was clearly a passion project, but ultimately I can't recommend this to anyone.

First off; no, it's not a metroidvania. It was given that tag by people who I assume have never played a metroidvania in their lives. You can upgrade your weapon but it's never useful besides one upgrade that has a chance to make your next shot do more damage. There's one other weapon you can get (the bazooka) but as far as I can remember it has no upgrades and a fully charged from it does not out-damage the upgrade I mentioned earlier.

The game's also strangely cryptic, giving you almost no hints for certain puzzles that are required to progress, such as one where you have to use the bazooka to splatter paint on a canvas. However, it HAS to be in a certain color and the color that the bazooka fires is entirely randomized. You're barely told any of this and my solution was to randomly shoot all over the area and rub up against everything until something magically happened. 

That wouldn't be a deal-breaker if it wasn't for the world design. Wuppo, I think, is a prime example of how NOT to design game worlds. The train that takes you to most major locations in the game is on a real-time schedule, meaning you have to literally queue for the train, get on, and then wait several minutes before you arrive somewhere else (there's a mini-game you can play and a coffee shop you can visit but you only get like a minute at that coffee shop and the conductor yells at you if you take too long.) It adds absolutely nothing other than tedium.

A small aside I want to mention; around two or three bosses I fought in either playthrough had instant kill attacks that you would never know were coming until you already got killed by them.

I never finished Wuppo despite its cute artstyle being very appealing to me, and I tried earnestly to give it two playthroughs. Ultimately if you want a game that's somewhat similar in style (an open but linear 2D platformer with a neat artstyle) I'd seriously recommend you go play Outland. This game just wasn't worth it to me.

(also also: the entire game is about "a lost Wum searching for a new home" but if you go back to the hotel at the beginning of the game, the guy there just says you can have your house back. Great narrative!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072689381', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1552914274}
review:
This game is a reason why I won't suicide yet. Everything in this game is right, atmosphere, music, background art, item, story, all of them is placed right. Although I'm still confused for some mission and need some walkthrough, yet it is still amaze me how complex and full of surprise this game is.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Good vibe and nice story
[*] Family friendly, for who want to buy for his/her children
[*] Superb level design and background art
[*] Catchy music
[*] Complex item and stuff that make impact in the story
[/list]

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
[list]
[*] Real time event (It's still interesting, yet it's kinda hurt to make a new save file to see another way of the story)
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Some mechanism is too confusing (for me... I guess)
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
9.5/10
A masterpiece. Although, I'm not finished this game yet, still encourage me to write this review. Worth to buy for a different happy little nice experience of gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058404391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1632107511}
review:
Didn't know what to expect from this game, went in after briefly reading reviews and seeing the overwhelmingly positive feedback rating. Always good to support indie games too. After beating it in 11 hours over a weekend glued to my monitor, I can say that these people deserve your $15.

This is a story driven, side-scrolling, platforming, adventure game that puts you in an original and imaginative little world. The game has a way of forcing you to explore every inch in order to find secrets, items, or how to advance. This tested my patience at times but never that badly as there are many places to search or even minigames to play.

I don't want to say much because its very easy to spoil the story, which the game paces out well. There's well over 2 hours of original music for the game too, which creates a great environment as there seems to be a new track for every new place you find to set the mood. 

I just want to say that while this game isn't perfect; the music, writing, comedy, and artstyle combine to make a world that you want to explore and know more about. Conveying a kind of heart you only seem to find in these kinds of games, its totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819391119', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1675272363}
review: 通关的时候超舍不得！！超爱这个游戏！全程瞎逛，主线是不存在的，通关了之后一直在找同类的游戏，都没有再看到比wuppo更好玩的了

author: {'steamid': '76561198375770197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1696285991}
review:
Wuppo ist ein sehr tolles Rätsel Spiel das sehr viel spaß macht. Die Rätsel sind nicht zu schwer, aber auch nicht zu leicht. Ein paar Bosse des Spieles haben micht manchmal schon genervt, aber auch die kann man ihrgentwann besiegen! Der Bossrush modus ist auch mal eine gute abwechslung zu anderen Spielen die so etwas nicht haben.  Ich persönlich habe rund 14 Stunden für das Spiel benötigt, das sehr schade ist, da ich mir ein längeres Gameplay gewünscht habe.

Ich empfehle Wuppo weiter, da es ein zwar leider kurzes aber sehr lustiges Spiel ist wo man auch rund 15 Stunden Spielzeit bezahlen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062623579', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1533086566}
review: this game is so painfully cryptic, giving nearly no direction to the player of any kind once you get past the introductory stuff. and once you do figure out what you have to do (by looking it up in a guide or something) it's some extremely vague thing you would've never even begun to think of doing. it feels more like researching for an essay than playing a game with how much you have to look up what to do next. also the mechanics are immensley basic and flat, art style is generic, simple, and bland, and the writing is really forgettable. it feels like a kid's game but even then it's a very poor one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321988224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1551187798}
review:
[quote=804]评测师招募中，你与好游戏，只有一个叽咪的距离[url=https://jq.qq.com/?_wv=1027&k=5fHaxv2] 点击加入叽咪-评测走读班	[/url]
欢迎关注[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/GimmGimm#curation] 叽咪叽咪鉴赏家	[/url] 
图文评测：https://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info?id=13760[/quote]
[h1]游戏玩法[/h1]

别看乌姆们小小的萌萌的，但在Wuppo的世界里，他们文武双全：[b]文能解谜武能射击[/b]。

游戏[b]以探索为主[/b]，有深度和难度的探索内容，让这个游戏的道具收集变得[b]极富挑战性[/b]。而在探索的过程中，你会遇见许多性格各异的乌姆，并且在与他们的聊天中获得来自他们的认可；也会来到其他乌姆去不到的地方收集四处散落的幻灯片，在播放它们的时候听幻灯片的讲解者们述说关于世界和种族的故事。

而游戏的重要环节则是BOSS战。游戏中的BOSS共有19个，除一部分BOSS是剧情需要一定会战斗的外，其余的BOSS则都可以[b]通过不同的方式避免战斗[/b]。如果不在海底制造声音，第一个BOSS绿色的鱼就不会出来攻击你；如果不杀狮子王的子民，狮子王就不会作为BOSS出现；如果不在信号灯下不停切换道具，信号灯就不会选择与你战斗......在我看来，这种设定带来的，是这些BOSS在凶狠的外表下，一颗人性化的心。（当然有一个成就是击败全部BOSS，为了全成就的玩家这些战斗应该是不可避免的[spoiler]=）[/spoiler]）

此外游戏还有[b]适量的解谜元素[/b]和一些有趣的，可以挣钱的[b]小游戏[/b]（我真的喜欢玩弗纳克球），这些小元素的存在，丰富了游戏的玩法，毕竟这么萌的小乌姆，不应该每天只是探草丛捡垃圾+打打杀杀的对吧。

[h1]游戏特点[/h1]

1.[b]萌！[/b]打开游戏的第一秒我就忍不住说出来“这也太萌了吧！”游戏的一些细节，比如在进行选择时乌姆会抿起小嘴往你选择的方向看，受到伤害时眼睛会变成一个X，在不同地面上走的声音各不相同而且有些地面的声音特别好听（哒哒哒哒哒哒~）让我有种忍不住想养一只乌姆的冲动。

2.难度分级，对不同目标的玩家有不同的难度。正常的通关游戏相对简单，大约十几到二十几个小时的流程即可完成游戏，因此对于目标是过关和剧情的快乐玩家来说这像是个小游戏；但[b]全成就的难度极高[/b]，而且没有完整攻略，对于目标是全成就的成就党和强迫症玩家来说，是一个很大的考验。

3.丰富的可阅读内容以及更丰富的选择。你在和几乎所有乌姆们聊天的时候都可以用不同的语气对话，或是鼓励安慰或是严肃认真，不同的选择获得的回复也会不同，但不用担心影响流程或结局——自由对话，[b]想说什么说什么[/b]。

[h1]结语[/h1]

一个星期的时间，我玩了28个小时的Wuppo。抛开评测的原因，这款游戏以优秀的游戏性和丰富的探索内容吸引了我。我曾极其喜欢团子大家族，甚至捏了好几个萌萌的团子粘土。而这个游戏给我带来的，就是[b]团子大家族变成了团子世界[/b]，每一个团子（乌姆），都可以在这个世界里，以它们独特的与三次元不同的方式，快乐幸福的生活着。

author: {'steamid': '76561198353194077', 'num_games_owned': 1004, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 2262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2262, 'last_played': 1533053596}
review:
画风丑萌丑萌的。
日期调到11.1日后能进入万圣节模式，南瓜BOSS太难了QAQ
打了一个多小时的南瓜BOSS才过，对手残不友好！
最后找到的窍门就是注意力放在乌姆身上，尽量保持在屏幕中间，中间能完美避开4南瓜的爆炸，而且不会被盘旋的小怪打中。
唔，应该会有兴趣开二周目。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025308485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1578798645}
review: Very fun game. Don't let the game's screenshots fool you. The game is beautiful and full of charm. It's not a perfect game, but it's a hidden gem that deserves more attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056623099', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1532897547}
review: Wuppo is an extremely cute game that plays somewhat similar to a metroidvenia combined with an artstyle and a compelling narrative reminiscent of the old n64 paper mario game. In short i highly recommend picking this game up (especially when it goes on sale during one of the steam sales) ^_^.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996423972', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1565629777}
review: It's weird.  It's fun.  It's strange.  But god this game is a masterpiece.  The second I got to the first big town in the game I felt a joy that I rarely see in video games today.  15 dollars is a steal for this game.
